description:
I've been eating at this place for 4 years. I don't know why it only has 3 and half stars currently because it's delicious. The sushi is super fresh all the time. Whether you order a roll, nigiri, or sashimi its always above average quality. I've introduced my friends to it, and they loved it too. Even a bar tender across the street told me her friend was visiting from Japan and agreed that sushi raw is fantastic. The environment of the restaurant is really standard, but the service is always great and friendly. I go on ladies night dates here and sip on sake with my friends. It's always a great pick with a really good happy hour most days. I have also tried their udon soup on one of San Francisco's iconically cold days and it did the trick. Would reorder. 

My motto with this place "take my money"
author: Kara F.

description: Terrible service. They do not care about customers at all. They cancelled my order because they do not deliver after a 3mi radius and I was 3.2mi. No call, no explanation, just cancelled after 30' wait.
author: Alejandra S.

description: Inept waitress messed up order in 3 ways and didnt comp us anything. (Not even a big order, only 2 people getting dinner). Near the end I noticed a medium size cockroach near my table. I like the sushiraw on taraval just wont come back to the one on haight
author: Grangrom D.

description: The dragon roll was Bomb!!! I will be ordering more food from them couldn't have picked a better place for sushi when I get off work.
author: kimiko l.

description:
Unfortunately I have to move my rating way down after a high rating years ago. 
I was a regular here for years. They started nickel and dimeing for anything extra(I ordered through an app and they refused to add spic mayo as something you paid for and would try to charge an excessive amount for it when you picked up), the quality of the meat declined drastically, and to top it all off they raised prices on their lower end items significantly. 
I loved this place but they have ripped me off, made me sick(yes the meat was that bad), and I just can't do it. I haven't ordered here after their price hike and I won't be again. Being next door only gets you so far. 
Sometimes it's ok, but it's rolling the dice every time.
author: Michael C.

description: One of the best places to go in the neighborhood. The owner is super nice and friendly. She looks out for me. We share sake together. The food is super fresh and delicious.
author: Rey B.

description: Great spot with good service. I am a regular here. They also gave me a free dessert and sake on a date once :)
author: Chad C.

description:
I took the Fried California Roll and it was amazing! As always. I love all the Sushi Raws !
Good price and good food!
author: Ode S.

description: Food was so terrible, that I almost threw up. Ordered the Fuji mountain roll - which seems like a better choice after reading the reviews. Had to throw the food away.
author: Megha B.

description: Went here with a few friends, fist off the vibe is great and the staff are very friendly. Our sushi was fresh, delicious, priced well. The ramen was well made and we had absolutely no complaints. Well priced Sake with plenty of choices, and they had the super chill music. We ended up staying here all night!
author: H W.

description: We're visiting San Francisco from Texas and we were walking around trying to find some kind of Asian food. We happened upon this place and lo and behold it was amazing! I had the unagi ramen, my boyfriend had a special roll and the tonkatsu, and my friend had the salmon teriyaki. Everything was so good! Good food, good sake, good music! Lovely atmosphere! Will come back again next time we're in San Francisco.
author: Kathleen C.

description: Very expensive for lower quality sushi.  Staff was friendly but very uneducated about the food.
author: Daniel G.

description: I have been for dinner a few times since my original review. Despite even more staff available for dinner, the service remains just as bad. The servers just have more people to chit chat with. The last time I ate here was in November 2016. Maybe the service has improved since then, but I have no inclination to try.
author: Trish B.

description: I like the food here, it was delicious and amazing. The happy hours worth for the value and the food. There are big oyster from Monday to Thursday. The service is good. One of the waitress saw my cup almost empty, she refill the water for me. The waitress also come to us to check up with us about the food the drink. I have an amazing night here.
author: Wu L.

description: Went back and got one of their bento dinners to go.  Their menu is kind of confusing since there are 2 different types of bentos and one includes side items (the single entrée choice option) and one doesn't (the 2 and 3 entrée/sashimi choice ones) which is what I ordered expecting to get more than I did. It really wasn't a lot of food so I was somewhat disappointed, especially when I'd even paid extra for a grilled fish substitution and was given such a tiny, thin portion of it.  They also left the very small bit of salad undressed and forgot to include any dressing.  Ditto the sauce that was supposed to go w/ the fish.  The food tasted good, however, and the waitress was very kind and accommodating despite my misunderstanding.
author: Rose B.

description: HORRIBLE SERVICE they are just cheap they have bad fish and if they make a mistake they make u pay for it. Don't go here unless u plan on getting so sick u go to the er. Also the manager has the intelligence of a door knob so asking for help is useless.
author: Jake W.

description:
First time trying this place for delivery and already disappointed. It took 1 hour and 45 mins to get my food, I called the restaurant after an hour and a half and spoke with a lady and told her its been over an hour and she said "oh the delivery driver went to the wrong address" so when my food came after 1hr and 45mins it was cold

I ordered a chicken teriyaki bento box and the chicken was kinda rubbery and bland with no taste it was not that great. The tempura shrimp and vegetables were good so I give 1 star. I didn't even eat the regular California rolls. I also ordered a Walnut Prawn Roll and it was OK I've had better. The deep fried California Roll was delicious so that's where they get the 2nd star 

I don't think its worth ordering delivery from them again
author: Lennie G.

description: This has some of the best sushi in San Francisco. The service and waiters are very nice. Come here for good SUSHI. The restaurant is very clean.
author: Victoria K.

description: Very good option for daily slush place. Pretty fresh fish, good prices, nice people. Don't expect something out of this earth.
author: Gus N.

description: This was a convenient choice. This isn't an "omg this is blowing my mind" sushi spot. The chirashi was pre made and sitting around for at least an hour and a half. The miso was good. The special rolls were decent. If you're desperate it's a good place. They have special deals too. I didn't get food poisoning and that's what's important.
author: E. R.

description: Amazing sushi, very creative, more importantly they are tasty too. Will come back again!
author: Junyi F.

description: Great food, great service! They were a little busy when we walked in, but everything was quick and delicious. It can get a little loud in there, so if you're looking for a quiet spot to catch up with people, might not be the greatest place, but besides that, no complaints. The four seasons roll is an experience. Looks like a work of art and tastes great.
author: Yasmeen G.

description:
I ordered delivery sushi from here. No gripes with the delivery time.

The first roll tasted like straight mayo and the rest smelled fishy. I had to spit it out because I started gagging. It sounds dramatic and maybe it was because they didn't have a fresh delivery of fish, but never again.
author: S B.

description:
Love this place! Kiki (mgr or owner?) made sure our time at Sushi Raw was nothing short of perfect!

One of our friends is allergic to shrimp, so Kiki was very careful telling us what did and did not contain shrimp when she brought our rolls to the table.

My party thought the fish was extremely fresh (contrary to what other reviewers have said), and the service was excellent.

Kiki even gave us some complimentary sake at the end, which was so sweet and unnecessary, but we greatly appreciated the gesture.

We will certainly be back again! Looking forward to trying this place at happy hour! Thanks for a fantastic Friday night dinner! :-)
author: Meaghan H.

description:
I've gone to Sushi Raw a few times when in lower Haight, craving sushi and the only other option at the time was Sushi 509, which isn't really great either. 

Sushi Raw seems to be at times an (almost) hit or total miss. I've tried several of their rolls and nigiri sushi and it never tastes fresh, sometimes the fish almost tastes mushy.

No matter what time or day I've visited, how slow or busy the place is, the service is just never there. I've never had rude service but the servers always have this "I don't care" or "when the hell is my shift over" attitude

I went in the other day, probably for the last time and ordered a chicken teriyaki bento plate and spicy salmon roll. The bento plate was a pretty good deal I thought; came with a small serving of tempura, and three pieces of nigiri for $15. That's about all that was good though. My salad came slopped in a horrendous tasting dressing, the entire bowl of lettuce was starting to brown (took one bite and left the rest uneaten) chicken was overcooked, tempura over battered and drenched in what seemed like seriously old oil, and the fish was not fresh at all. My salmon roll actually came out decently enough but I think the best part of my meal was actually the miso soup and green tea.

As I said, don't think I'll stop here again when in the neighborhood. There's a new place, Raijin, which I've tried several times as well now... Seems promising and a hell of a lot better than what's currently available on this little lower Haight strip
author: Pauline T.

description:
I can only attest to the takeout here, and only about the red dragon roll. After experiencing a less than stellar experience at another sushi restaurant in the city, this place was a wonderful change! 

Ordering was easy--I placed my order through Yelp (eat24) and set the time for 7:10. I arrived early at 7:03, and had to wait a few minutes because I was early. No biggie, and the food was prepared quickly. I also asked for extra soy sauce, and they gave me 4 packets!

The red dragon roll (avocado and shrimp tempura inside, spicy tuna on top) was quite filling and tasted quite fresh. The spicy tuna held its composure (I.e., there weren't discernible chunks of tuna, which I suppose some people prefer, but I like when it has a soft texture) and the shrimp tempura stayed crispy. Definitely will order again and perhaps try other rolls too (if you're looking to get a bigger meal with the same fish components, the red dragon roll costs the same as one spicy tuna and one shrimp tempura roll).
author: Julia N.

description: I usually get a simple order of Sake & Sake (Salmon and sake). Popped in for lunch special and the salmon sashimi was 5 huge slices of fresh, buttery fish for 7.99. I actually thought the plate ware was delicate and pretty, which is usually not the case in sushi spots so nice touch. Construction on the street so gotta move my car! Ha
author: Zoe M.

description:
FOOD:
Chirashi bowl - it seemed skimpy...and didn't come with miso or salad. 
Chicken teriyaki - I like how it came with two nigiri and miso soup 


SERVICE:
Good but kinda slowish 


ATMOSPHERE:
Not bad I like it.

Overall I would much prefer to go to another spot for Japanese. 

11.15.13
author: Angela L.

description: Love!!! I come here all the time with my family. It has a great vibe and the employees are very welcoming. Food is greatly presented with its own creativity and the taste is on point too. Can't wait to bring my friends over because they are really missing out on good sushi.
author: Jamie L.

description: Delicious food! The service is pretty slow which was annoying because we were there late, around 8 PM on a Thursday, so it was post-happy hour. We were also one of the few people there so it didn't really make sense. Anyway, I can overlook it because everything we ate was delicious! The $1 oyster special was fantastic - delicious, meaty, big oysters. I could have had 20 and been full, but I wanted to try out other menu items (:
author: Mio W.

description: For the price and easy accommodation, I really like this place. I came here with a large group of friends and we were able to sit at a large table on the upper level. Food came out quickly and our meal was very well-priced. It wasn't the best sushi that I ever had, but I liked the quality overall and how easy this place was. I would go back.
author: Cindy B.

description: If you're looking for a sushi restaurant with good service and food, this is the place to go. Definitely one of the best sushi places I've ever went to. Not only are their sushi set at a reasonable price, you'll also get your money's worth because of its size. This restaurant always satisfies my cravings for sushi.
author: Tiffany L.

description: A nice and welcoming environment. You would feel so welcomed here by the staff and especially the owner. I come here 3-4 each month at times. This place is my go-to for good sushi and fresh sashimi. You won't find any other place with a roll that isn't overpriced for its size. Love it here!
author: Garrick L.

description:
This has got to be my favorite sushi place in SF!! I've now been here four times and it's gets better every time. The staff is super friendly and informative and helpful. Food is fresh and tasty. 

Happy hour is amazing Mon - TH and you can get very high quality oysters for a buck. 

I highly recommend the walnut prawn roll and the Hamachi sashimi.  So delicate and fresh.  Also found out THEY DELIVER!

Great, clean restaurant with great food.
author: Amie B.

description:
Just moved to San Francisco a couple months ago. My girlfriend works at a sushi restaurant so it's been our mission to find a great sushi spot - and we definitely found it here.

The rolls were so big and filling, very reasonably priced, fresh, and beautifully decorated. The staff was really friendly. This is definitely a new go-to spot for the lady and I.

We ordered 4 rolls. Our favorite was definitely the eclipse! (Although they were all really good). Definitely check this place out.
author: Tyler G.

description:
Great selection of rolls! & also good deals on large beers - Asahi, Kirin, and Sapporo. I recently went to their happy hour which happens daily from 4:30-7pm. Their happy hour is quite nice. They do $2-3 off of some rolls as well as a buy one, get one large beer for $2 - not too shabby as a regular large beer is $5.50, so you get 2 for around $8.

The service here is very friendly. The rolls are fresh and I really don't have any complaints. Is it the best sushi I've had? No. But it's affordable and good quality!

Their also never too busy and have TVs playing one of the sports games going on.

Nice job, Sushi Raw!
author: Junel S.

description:
Had a Tekka Maki (just tuna roll) last night and it was NOT FRESH. I wish I had said something because it was gross. 

The New York roll was bland but good. 

We really loved the Double Hamachi Roll and to fill up we decided to order the chicken teriyaki roll considering the fish wasn't fresh. 

The service wasn't great either. 

Honestly, that double hamachi roll is so good that I'd maybe just get take out for that,
author: Emma M.

description:
I ordered delivery and thought the sushi and sashimi were solid. The rolls could've been packed more tightly (the one with cucumber and crab totally fell apart but was pretty to look at).

The Miso soup with clams was savory - I just wished for another clam or two. The clams were sweet and delicious.

I'll definitely order again.
author: Jennifer O.

description: This is my all time favorite sushi place ever. Great service and the food never disappoints. For delivery they never take the full time it says - always early, never late! I highly recommend to everyone, and I go here and/or order from here all the time! Best sushi in SF hands down!
author: Ann W.

description: I used to love this place and come here all the time when I lived in the area. I recently returned, excited for my nostalgia high, and left pretty underwhelmed. I'm not sure if they've changed owners, chefs, suppliers, or however it works, but the fish didn't taste as fresh or have the quality I remembered, and I felt like I had to add more spices than usual to my ramen soup for the flavor to come out. On a positive note, the tonkatsu that came with the ramen was great, and our service was decent enough, our food arriving just before we got impatient, and our waitress checking in on us attentively while also giving us space. The place also has a low-light, intimate ambience, and while they seem popular and busy with customers, there's never a wait and it doesn't feel claustrophobic.
author: Kaitlyn L.

description:
Came here for lunch with my boss. He didn't like the Sushi Raw on Mission and it turns out I don't like the one here very much. I didn't even know they had a location in lower haight. 

We were the only other people during the lunch hour which is kind of surprising. We got the seaweed salad to start. I got the salmon teriyaki bento and he got the 16 piece sashimi. His order came with complimentary miso soup but they ended up forgetting my salad. The waitress also did not bring tea when I asked but brought it after my boss asked wtf. 

The California rolls were pathetic. They were tiny and I kid you not looked like leftovers from someones lunch. The sashimi tasted awful but the portions were big. No way was it fresh. The tea was solid though.

Their credit card machine was broken for some reason so they took down his information and charged it later. Definitely will not be coming back here. The one on Mission is way better.
author: Tiffany V.

description: If i could give 0 stars, i would. The person who takes order over the phone is not capable of talking with people, gave us a terrible service. She needs to learn how to be a restaurant host. And we ordered 2 hrs ago and got the order at 9:50 pm!!! 2 hrs to receive your order? That doesn't worth it. Don't get anything from there. I am extremely unsatisfied with the service!!
author: Nagihan E.

description: Oh my god. So disappointed. I have ordered delivery more than a dozen times with no problem. Food was fine. But tonight it's delivery person couldn't figure out how to ring our doorbell. Really? He later admitted he didn't even ring the door bell and instead just tried for 15 minutes to call us. Wrong number. So he left. By the time he made a second attempt, the food was soggy and the sushi packaged in with the hot entree was cooked. Called restaurant to demand a refund. They offered a 30% discount that never came. Never never never again.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Place is small & cozy. I really liked the spot, especially since we made the happy hour special. Their variety is great...many fresh & many "breaded" or oven cooked items. The variety is all there so i'm positive everyone will walk out happy. 

Ordered...
+edamame
+miso soup (mm)
+Spicy tuna
+haight street

all delicious. Only issue....I kid you not....something was really salty, not sure if it was the wasabi or maybe the rice. I definitely left with a cotton mouth, drank about a jar of water & still kept drinking water once I arrived home. Don't want to exaggerate but it was also a comment from my friends. Regardless...Kuddos Sushi Raw...you are pretty good. See you soon!
author: Priscilla N.

description: One of my favorite Japanese restaurant.  The service was great and the wait staff made sure we had a great time.  The sashimi is great and reasonably priced.  We will definitely come back.
author: Chak L.

description: Fish is not fresh, food is not great but it's cheap.  Go elsewhere in the neighborhood for a few bucks more (Nara which is 1 block away for example). Will not go back.
author: Margaux M.

description:
This place is not bad, but could be so much better with a little more effort.

The fish is decent, but the chefs really don't seem to put a lot of care into their rolls. They're usually kind of haphazardly put together - sometimes they open where the seaweed should seal the roll shut - and with way more rice than fish, which is my biggest gripe. They definitely skimp on the amount of fish they put in each roll. Prices vary from in the $4 range for the simple rolls (maki) to $12-$15 for the fancier ones.

The servers are friendly, and the atmosphere is just okay. It's fine for a quick dinner if you're in the area, but I wouldn't recommend it as a date spot or anything. 

Happy hour specials are pretty good - small sake for $.99 (can't beat that!), and large sake for $1.99.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Giving Sushi Raw 5 stars for delivery. Everything was delicious and fresh. Delivery was also very fast, and the whole order was very affordable. Two of us ate (and were soooo full after) for $40. Can't beat that for sushi. They make a rice-less roll too that is rolled in thinly cut cucumber. I can't always eat rice, so it was perfect and held together. 

My Fiancé and I will definitely order from them again.
author: Jessica K.

description:
So far as great sushi goes, I haven't been able to find much in San Francisco. I sampled a ton of hopeful spots, only to be crushed with high prices and disappointment. While this isn't the best sushi, it's definitely fresh at a decent price. 

I got the Chef's Choice 8 piece NIgiri for about $14. It was a great way to sample their selection. And it was pretty filling! Ok, after I ate half my boyfriend's food. And ordered extra samples 

The fatty tuni, uni, yellowtail, and raw kobe beef were by far the best nigiri pieces I had.

He got a bento box with beer teriyaki. The beef was kind of tough and not very lean. Maybe just stick to sushi here.

Overall, not too expensive and always pretty quite. Maybe worth trying.
author: Nicole G.

description:
I ordered delivery from here off of grubhub.com. The food arrived in a timely fashion. There's a $20 minimum for delivery. I got the spicy tuna roll, haight st roll, miso soup, seaweed salad, and a can of Sprite to but me over the minimum. The haight street roll wasn't that good. The spicy tuna roll though was better than your average one because the amount of spice was more than I'm used to, which is fine.

The food overall was just OK. The convenience factor was key. For spending around $25 including tip, I thought I'd have left overs. So, that's why it doesn't get as good of a rating. If I go to Molly Stone's for 2 orders of Sushi I'd pay the same but get A LOT more.
author: Marty J.

description:
I wanted to like this place because it's so close by to where I live, but unfortunately the sushi is not up to par. I'd rather walk an extra 10 minutes to Hayes Valley for Otoro or Domo sushi or even go to Sushi 509 down the street. 

My friend and I shared 4 rolls, miso soup, and a sashimi/ceviche-like salad. The best parts were the miso and the salad. The rolls were poorly made and the fish was not high quality. Everything was edible, but not worth the $30 that I spent. Plus, the service was lacking. I will not be returning to Sushi Raw and I would not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Lisa K.

description: I've been here a few times for lunch,  each time the sushi was super  fresh and excepetionally delicious!  The service is great- the hostess is pleasant and helpful when needing suggestions or recommendations.  This is my new favorite sushi restaurant in the city.  I would come here multiple times a week if I lived closer!
author: Liz B.

description:
Okay sushi. The service was pretty slow, but nice. They weren't busy at all and we waited 10+ minutes after asking for our check -- wasn't really sure why. But a decent meal! The tuna was a little weird for me, but I'm not the biggest sushi fan. 

Probably won't come back, but if you're a sushi aficionado then why not give it a try?
author: Joel A.

description:
My friend told me about this spot.  How they have a happy hour going on and its very reasonable.  So what the heck, I'll check it out.  

Walk in and I was the only person there.  Sat by the bar and looked at the Chinese waitress and sushi chef.  Yes, they are my people that own this joint.  How lovely. . . .so I pretend not to speak it and just listen in on their conversations.  They talked about a co-worker who couldn't make it to work because somehow, she slipped and fell on glass.  The chef with the anime hair comments, "how sexy" is that.  Um, wrong adjective but creative, to say the least.

I checked out the happy hour menu.  The beer and sake was buy one get one free, which was a thumbs up for me.  Then there was a select number of rolls and all only had about $2 off.  I ordered the rock n' roll, eclipse and red dragon.  Rock n' roll was just your ordinary roll, but the other two, was all filling.  Felt like they stuffed it was pureed and sauce filled spicy tuna.  And the chunk of Philly cream cheese in the eclipse was massive, so it was all that I tasted.  I guess I'm a girl who likes to taste texture of the fish, and not a mushed up mucky muck.   

The bill still came out pretty high for a happy hour, but at least a decent crowd started coming thru by the time that I left at around 5ish.  It was alright, but nothing to say, it blew me away.  Just avoid the puree and you may have fun, with their packed full menu of choices.
author: Janice F.

description:
I still haven't found my go-to sushi place in the city.  I came here for happy hour so the sushi was cheap!  Not a huge selection, but still a lot to choose from.

I wasn't incredibly impressed by the food, but I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 3 because the service was great.  Everyone in there was so friendly :)
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Stopped here solely because I was hungry and I passed it. Got the lunch special. Good portion for a lunch special for the price. 

The rolls were weird though, can't put my finger on it. My California roll tasted like a crab salad, which wasn't my idea of "fresh."
author: Jess S.

description: This is one of my favorite Japanese spots on the city. Huge menu with something for everyone. all of their ramen is great, especially given the price. Tempura udon is also one of my favorites, the tempura batter they use is phenomenal. I highly recommend this place at a easy/affordable sushi spot
author: Bryanna M.

description:
Sushi deliciousness!!!!  I really enjoy and appreciate the attention to detail as well as the quality of fish and produce.
 The servers are top notch with a great sense of humor  as well! 
Looking to eat here for some time to come!
author: Gene P.

description:
We used to order from here all the time, but after the latest fiasco, never again. We placed at 8pm, and waited.  When 9 rolled out, the food still hasn't arrived, so we called the restaurant and were assured the food would be there any minute.  Then 9:30 rolled around, still no food. Called again, and got another brush off that "the food will be there in the next 5 minutes."  Then 10pm rolls around, and still no food.  Called again, and we're given the same BS. Finally around 10:30, the food shows up, but is disgusting.  The hot food was cold and rubbery, while the sushi was hot and inedible.  It was so bad we ended up tossing it.

The owner refused to hear our complaints or offer any sort of discount.  Fortunately, we'd ordered through eat24, who was so appalled by the behavior of the restaurant that they gave us a full refund.
author: Kevin O.

description:
Customer service: 9/10
Cleanliness: 8.5/10
Food: Hit or miss 6/10
We ordered roll specials from 6pm-7pm several times. They were not good. The walnut shrimp rolls had rancid walnuts and 1 shrimp.  Many pieces had no shrimps.  Unremarkable california rolls and other rolls.  Barely any soft shell crab in the spider roll.
Good but over-oiled hamachi kama appetizer
Beef with curry sauce is a hit or miss - sometime tasty sometime bland.
We only eat here because our friends live close by and it's convenient for us to meet here.
author: G D.

description:
Food was amazing, very fresh. Great selection of rolls! Probably the best sushi I've ever had. Waitress are very helpful and attentive. Love their happy hour menu. . They do $2-3 off of some rolls as well as a buy one, get one large beer for $2.
I ordered few nigiri and maki, but also a couple of appetizers. I think they have a very good salmon nigiri and spicy tuna roll.  I highly recommend to try their BBQ squid. It is my favor dish!
author: Hiumei Z.

description:
Service was top notch. 

Maguro and hamachi was top quality - we sat at the bar and got a good look at it and the other fish. It all looked good. 

One complaint: We got a soft-shelled crab roll. The oil in which the crab was deep-fried  definitely was past time it needed to be changed (it's the sort of thing you recognize if you own your own deep frier). It wasn't terrible, but we should have sent it back. Oh well. 

Prices were also good. We will definitely be back.
author: Tim W.

description:
Delicious, and very fast delivery. Definitely ordering again!
We had: spicy tuna roll, spicy salmon roll, California roll, cucumber (rice less) roll, height street roll.
Fresh and everyone was extremely pleased!

Thank you =)
author: Danny M.

description: This is my go to sushi place! Great sushi and a super friendly staff! They also deliver on eat 24. Definitely a plus ! The only thing is, it can get quite pricey. Go during their happy hour for discounted drinks and sushi options!
author: Katherine H.

description: Do not ever order from this place. They will take 6x longer than then they claim and then they will lie to you about it repeatedly that it is orderahead.com's fault, not theirs.
author: Jill B.

description:
Came here for Kathy D's joint b-day...rolling deep with 30 people!  As she mentioned the restaurant is small and narrow with an upstairs section for more seating (ideal for a party).  

Staff was extremely friendly & attentive.  The bf & I shared an order of the deep fried California roll ($7.95).  I ordered the chicken teriyaki bento ($9.95) which came with mixed tempura and three pieces of sushi, as well as the standard soup and salad.  He got the three choice bento ($13.95) with short ribs, chicken teriyaki, & shrimp tempura. The roll wasn't bad, but was cut super thin!  It was hard to get the roll to our mouths without any filling falling out or the roll falling apart.  The soup was a little salty.  I liked the salad dressing though, as it was more Asian style vs. the usual mayo based dressing that you see at many Japanese restaurants.  My bento was enough for me.  The chicken teriyaki was standard & the tempura batter was good, and totally was perfect for my tummy for drinking later on that night.  I gave the sushi to bf since I don't really eat fish.  All of us also shared bottles of Wakatake Sake (cold) that went down oh so smooth & didn't taste like booze, which means that it's a lethal creeper later on!  

I thought it was amusing how one of the waitresses kept saying that the sake bottle was tiny, and that a roll was too tiny for three people to share.  I kept thinking to myself, "Why is everything so tiny here?!"  All in all, Sushi Raw is not the best Japanese restaurant I've ever been to, but it's not bad.  I'd say give them a chance if you're craving Japanese food if you're in the area.
author: Cat C.

description: Good sushi for a good price. Its always fresh and fast. They do great if you're in the restaurant. Some of the fancy rolls are really good, as are the plain ones.  The Unagi has only been sub par, but the other fish is great.
author: Lily C.

description:
Party of 30 for a double birthday dinner.  They were more than accommodating to us, which I am thankful for, especially for the late comers!  The venue itself is small and skinny.  There is an upper floor, which was where we were located.  The restaurant is dimmed and has a simple modern decor with a sushi bar up front.  When we left at around 9pm, there was a line outside, probably because of us! 

Ordered:

Hot Summer roll- $13, Spicy tuna roll with crab meat, salmon baked and tobigo sauce.

This roll was actually nicely presented and was delicious and tasty. I enjoyed it a lot but I felt like it was a pretty small portion roll, since I ate it all within like 10 minutes.  It kept me pretty full though since the large sakes kept coming out.

The Green Tea Cheesecake- not worth it.  You can barely taste any green tea at all!  Go for the tiramisu instead if you are craving for sweets!

Would definitely come back if I am ever in the Haight area again!
author: Kathy D.

description: Wanted a quick snack before dinner, and this is a block from where we're staying before AIDS Life Cycle. The Jalapeño Roll is very good, I wasn't expecting it to be so tasty. The Lovers Roll was also very good.
author: Jorge D.

description: I would give this restaurant 6 stars but sadly I can't. This place was amazing and unique! The manager recommended the omakase so we decided to give it a try since it was our first time there. All the items the sushi chef prepared for us were delectable. Four dishes that really stood out to me was the salmon and tuna tartar, Kobe beef, Otoro sashimi (aka fatty tuna) and Truffled Hirame. The salmon and tuna tartar was very unique. It was a dish with shrimp chips surrounding guacamole filled with salmon and tuna. It was a tasty and crispy appetizer. Next, he Kobe beef was fantastic. It tasted as great as it smelled! The beef was very juicy and delicious that I'm 100% ordering that every time. Also, the Otoro sashimi was just as fresh as the salmon I mentioned before. Very well done to the point where I don't think I can find this quality anywhere else in S.F. The Truffled Hirame's sauce's flavor was very distinctive. Lastly, the manager Kiki, was really nice and polite and she made sure everything was going smoothly!  I really recommend you to give this a try! :) ( Truffle Hirame and Salmon and tuna tartar NOT ON THE MENU. MUST ASK CHEF)
author: William F.

description: There is no point in ordering online for delivery because the food will never arrive. Called them an hour and a half after I ordered and they said they never saw the order (but that they did receive it). Asked them if they could expedite but they said it would take another hour. Poor customer service...I do not recommend this place.
author: Lester W.

description: I regularly order a few vegetable sushi items, which I always have delivered.  So my experience with Sushi Raw is very narrow, but having said that, I am a happy customer.  I especially appreciate the fast delivery time.
author: Ian F.

description:
We got sushi delivered from here tonight, and I have no complaints whatsoever. We didn't get any nigiri because this was drunk food, and frankly we were a little nervous about the concept of our fish sitting in some dude's car for an hour or so. 

That being said, our food came in about twenty-five minutes! Pretty good for a Friday night after a 45-60 minute delivery time estimate. 

Everything was really good, but I can't give it five stars because everything we got was really safe. Maybe next time I'll get real sushi, and I'll update it to five starts if the food is good. We ordered hamachi kama (not sushi but cooked yellowtail collar--I've never had one that wasn't delicious), avocado maki, spicy tuna, tamago, seaweed salad, and the free California roll that got thrown into the bunch because we ordered $25 of food. As you can see, this wasn't a gourmet sushi night, but everything was delicious and we finished every bite (even the faux-crab California roll!).
author: Jenny M.

description: I order from sushi raw every once in a while. Good size portion and good quality products. Great value for your money.
author: Hadria W.

description: Literally my favorite sushi place in SF! Such good pieces of raw fish and affordable, plus they're so nice to greet you when you walk in, love this place!
author: Natalie A.

description:
Sushi Raw should consider truth in advertising. Nothing raw about this restaurant, it's all "fresh" from the freezer. If you want real sushi, do not visit this restaurant.

We made our fourth visit to this chain restaurant last night, it will be our last. Service was acceptable, we were greeted at the door, offered a table upstairs adjacent a family with kids running every which way. Our waiter delivered menus, gave us ample time to review, then took our order.

Again, service was adequate, but...

Beer and wine arrive within minutes of ordering. Miso soup and salad a couple a seconds later. Within three minutes, our sushi and bento boxes show up. Excuse me, but can we finish our soup first?

Each piece of sashimi appeared to be recently thawed. The shioyaki looked and tasted like it was drawn from a frozen tray as well, grilled frozen, and completely dried out. That took some effort on the cooks part.

Wasabi was fake, made from colorized mustard powder, not wasabi root. 

Okay...so we got frozen/thawed fish. The rice was old, the miso soup, so-so, the Chirashi disgusting, and the Bento box a rip off. 2 ounces of overly dried out mackeral, a scope of stale rice, four pieces of floury tempura.

Sorry guys, the Haight needs good restaurants, especially a decent Japanese dinner house, but this place is marginal, best case. There are far too many GOOD sushi places in San Francisco than to risk poisoning oneselve eating cafeteria style food at Sushi Raw.

AVOID
author: Joseph F.

description:
YUM! Got the Red Dragon roll and it was SOOO good! I could tell everything in it was extremely fresh. I only wish it was a little bigger. Usually I get one roll and a miso soup and that suffices as a good dinner but this was just a little on the small side.

The staff was very friendly and I love that they offered us tea or water while we waited for our to-go order to be made.

The atmosphere was really cool and modern and big! Would be fun for a sake bombing birthday group or something.
author: Alexandra W.

description: The food was so-so, I've never had a sushi roll that was cut like salami, sliced very thin made it hard to eat. This place is very big and can hold a lot of people, with a few TVs.
author: Kalani M.

description: It's Friday night in the lower haight and you're sitting at the squat and gobble like a jamook. Quit acting like a jabroneeeee and get dis fish playa! They have a happy hour special. Why you gotta make things complicated?
author: Joseph B.

description: A good place to go when the other places are full. Don't come if you don't like jpop, fish smell and Lower Haight. Big portions but the fish is not the best I've ever eaten.  Not a very romantic place, but definitely a backup plan's dinner place.
author: Florentin H.

description:
Good local spot. Not life-changing in terms of sushi quality, but more than adequate when the urge strikes. 

Rolls tend towards the deep fried/mayonnaise-slathered/cream-cheesy, but there are a lot of good and innovative combinations.

Sushi bar is nice; tables (especially the ones towards the back) are a little dimly lit and depressing. 

Happy hour is great: Substantial discounts on beers/sake and about eight or nine rolls.
author: Jimbo H.

description: great oysters and sake. at the bar you can watch how the rolls are made. that is amazing!
author: Dani S.

description: Good! Love the Pink Lady Roll. If you like vegetarian sushi go here! They have a page of vegetarian sushi and it is all good. I love it. Thank you sushi raw!
author: Genevieve J.

description:
When I see sea bass on the menu I get it, no questions asked!  I love the delicate silky consistency, the blackened corners and the light miso glaze.  Their sea bass was NONE of the above and to top it off there were sneaky fish bones everywhere.  

Everything else was good, sashimi, tempura, and the rolls.  We also got a good recommendation for sake from our server.  Everyone was nice and very efficient in the beginning but things just started sliding as we were wrapping up our meal.  It was obvious we were done but several servers walked by our table without any acknowledgment.  It was a good thing we were trying to kill time.
author: Rosalind S.

description: That was the freshest, softest, melt-in-your-mouth, tasty, delicious sushi I've had in a long time. And I'm sushi Crazay! Cray Cray cuckoo!!!
author: Penguin P.

description:
LOVE this place... Their wasabi is real, not powder with water... Their seaweed is fresh and not chewy!!! The rice to veggie ratio is perfect! They have made their specialty rolls vegetarian when I have asked... Love that... And putting mango in the roll is so delicious!!!! 
Fantastic sake menu!
author: Nana W.

description: Favorite to-go sushi restaurant in SF. Decent prices and great service!! Thanks sushi raw!
author: Matthew R.

description:
I come here often with my friends and we always have a good time! Fresh fish and great selection of food to choose from! I love their grilled squid - great smoky flavor, great as an appetizer and with drinks~ Their sushi rolls are all flavorful and wonderfully plated. My favorites are double hamachi and four seasons. Don't forget the tempura - its crispy and not doughy at all!

They also have a great selection of sake, but on a cold day - a cup of hot sake is what I'd go for~ Their hospitality is good, I was always greeted with a smile when we ask for something. This is definitely my "go to spot" for some great fish and drinks with friends.
author: Nick Z.

description:
The happy hour here makes me wish I had deals like this in LA.  

We were able to get 5 Rolls and 4 drinks for under $50, and you just can not beat that.  The sushi was fresh and well prepared.  

The drink specials are not "buy one get one free", but "Buy one get one for $0.99 small or $1.99 large"  Which is still a pretty freaking good deal.  :)

If I lived in SF, I would return.
author: Meg M.

description: Good sushi. Good prices. Great happy hour. The reason for 5 stars, most of all, is that I went in to pick up an order and left my keys on the counter. I walked out with my headphones on and the woman working, instead of waiting for me to come back, chased me down two blocks. Not often you get that kind of treatment.
author: Shay C.

description: Came here with friends for dinner and had a wonderful time. Ordered some sashimi and it taste very fresh. Meso soup was better than most jap rest cause it's not as salty. They have different types of rolls and all the ones we ordered was good. Price was just right and had an overall great experience. Will recommend and will definitely come back.
author: Ace Z.

description: Amazing sushi and ramen. Innovative and inventive rolls made by a great chef. Friendly staff. Highly recommend this place.
author: Shane G.

description: This is our go-to neighborhood sushi place. Love the staff, they are always really nice and in 5 years I've only had to wait for a table once. Favorite rolls: Taraval St, Niagra Falls, Lion King, Double Hamachi. Happy hour from 4:30-6:30!
author: Erika D.

description: Fast service.It's not the best sushi I've ever had, but they have totally solid rolls. Spider. Dragon rolls etc. Fantastic happy hour deals even on the weekends. 5 expensive rolls.  2 large sapporos. 2 large sakes. Total bill? $48. I'm coming back.
author: David A R.

description: Great sushi, great service. We had dinner here a night ago, the sushi tasted fresh and well prepared. Der order the four season roll.
author: Khaled B.

description:
I love this place. It is my go to sushi place in the neighborhood. I usually get one of the bento boxes because it is so much food for your money. You choose the entree you want. I usually get on of the fish dishes and it comes with rice, salad, miso soup, three pieces of sushi (salmon, tuna and yellow tail) and then four pieces of mixed tempura. 

The udon is ok but I have enjoyed the bento every time.
author: Marisa M.

description: Delicious sushi!  We went Sunday night after the Super Bowl, got seated quickly, had our order placed and sushi arrived shortly after. Also got to see a couple have a full on drunk argument culminating in  the guy leaving before the food arrived. Needless to say, no one from his group went after him, they were waiting to eat and the food is  THAT good. Fresh, great portions.
author: Bee C.

description:
Oh Sushi Raw. How I have such a love-hate sake headache for you. They like their drinkers there, and sake bomb competitions were egged on at my last visit.

The sushi is good. It's not groundbreaking or brilliant, but it's good. There's some fun rolls and interesting presentations that include fire. If you're looking to be blown away and amazed, pay the extra money and go somewhere else. If you're looking for a fun night out with friends and sake, this is a great place for it.
author: Jay V.

description: Great for sushi delivery! Super speedy. Love the Haight roll.
author: lauren h.

description: Pretty basic sushi here. They have a GREAT happy hour. Best happy hour in the Lower Haight Area. Really good prices.
author: Mario W.

description:
With only a few blocks separating me from this little sushi gem, I've trekked over numerous times.  Personally, I think sushi is always better at a restaurant, so I haven't experienced their takeout.

They're always friendly and greet you as soon as you walk in.  I also like how they have bar seating with a front row view of the sushi chef.  I've come a few times for lunch during the work week, and it was completely comfortable flying solo.  They're also great for small groups and have always been very attentive.

The sushi probably isn't the very best I've had, but nevertheless it's always tasty and reasonably priced.
author: Jamie B.

description:
New and so needed in the Lower Haight area.  

Huge dining space - would be good for large groups.  The staff is attentive and very friendly.  The owner and head sushi chef, Simon, knows his stuff and obviously takes a  lot of pride in what he's serving and how he's serving it.  Well-rounded menu of sashimi, nigiri, rolls, and lots of great hot plates and soups!  Everything I had was delicious.  Really affordable lunch specials too.  They are having a 2 for 1 hot saki and beer deal to celebrate their grand opening right now.  I think this place will end up being a local favorite.  Me like.
author: Dizzy L.

description:
Favorite local Japanese haunt -- beautiful sashimi and nigiri. Great prices. Very good service. Fun to sit at bar to watch preparation of food. Always easy seating; never had to wait. Sufficient space and availability for large parties.

Their rolls are not the reason I go; they're merely average. Ambience is lacking; wish it felt more cozy inside.
author: Jess A.

description: Beware! The waitress will suggest $7 worth of miso soup and salad to your Happy Hour menu. I feel conned and will never dine here again. $3 California rolls becomes $30 really fast this way. Food this good should not mean unresponsive service (asking for everything!) and a bait n switch.
author: Shelly C.

description:
Don't do it! This review is strictly for their take-out service/quality.  I tried ordering from the Mission street location because their website said that location delivered to my zip code.  After an hour or so we called them and they told us they transferred our order to their Haight street location.

When we finally received our food we were already feeling disappointed with the service so our expectations for the food weren't very high.  They put the mis0 soup on top of our sushi combos so our fish was warm and gross.

The fish is not the freshest I've had. I guess I can be happy I didn't get an upset stomach or anything.

I will continue in my search for awesome sushi delivery.
author: Becca L.

description:
I like this place mostly for its location (only a few blocks away from apartment). But pardon my laziness, but I've only ordered take out from this place. Why walk six blocks, when I can have someone else walk (er most likely drive) the six blocks for me and hand deliver my food? The choice is obvious my friends. Plus the walk is hill-y!

One thing I do love about Sushi Raw is their excellent online ordering system. It is just super easy to use plus like most of us AT&T users in SF our cellphone reception is terrible, so it's hard to make a simple phone order at times. Online ordering is a beautiful thing. 

In terms of the menu offerings, I would say this place is a pretty generic Japanese restaurants with a bunch of crazy rolls topped with a lot of sauce. There's nothing wrong with that, just thought I would let you know. I crave that type of food on occasion and I regularly turn to Sushi Raw to satisfy that desire.

I like the baked rolls so my favorite is the Fuji Mountain Roll (love the name, it sounds so regal). Lobster baked with crab meat and covered in some kind of spicy sauce?! Not bad at all! If I were you I would avoid the raw stuff, I've ordered sashimi and the chirashi (sashimi over rice) and it really doesn't do it for me. The fish isn't all that fresh in my opinion. 

My recommendation is that you go with the sushi rolls that have the most elaborate names (almost all the specialty rolls on the menu) and the rolls that come with some kind of ridiculous and calorie intensive sauce.
author: Allan Y.

description:
Happy Hour sushi? Yessir, Im on my way. 

I expected the sushi to be mediocre at best, but I was pleasantly surprised that it was actually delicious. 
I've eaten at those cheap sushi places before and always left with a stomachache, not this place tho =) 

We got the deep fried cali roll, chicken teryaki bento, spicy tuna roll, and the hot summer roll.
Definitely dont regret any of said items above, and definitely plan on coming back soon.
author: Corey W.

description: Decent rolls and sake, perfect place to stop after having a few drinks at nearby bars.  The waru was very good!  I also had an interesting roll with cucumber wrap instead of nori.
author: Kate Marie G.

description:
Have been there several times and I love it. The place is casual and quite big for a Japanese restaurant. The food is excellent and cheap too!

I usually order the BENTO box. They have really great deals you get some tempura, veggies; you can choose between salmon, chicken teryniaki and others. For a small amount you can also add sushi or sashimi to your bento. They are freshly made in front of you at the bar.
Nothing fancy but high quality food at a very affordable price.
author: caroline s.

description: I'm still a fan, my 1st time getting their lunch special bento lunch and it was good. Nothing to rave about, all taste fresh no complaints. I think I will stick with sushi here though, their sushi is good!
author: Karen T.

description: Great food, great service, great sake bombing. Will be back again for sure! Get the spicy tuna tempura with avocado and the sashimi platter!
author: Justin G.

description: Needed a quick bite to eat before we headed to Danny Coyle's to watch the UFC fights. Good choice to stop here! We had the Hamachi sashimi, Uni, Hamachi Kama, & a few other rolls. Everything was good & prices are even better. Would definitely stop here again next time we're on Haight.
author: Jazzy S.

description:
Pros:
If bar crudo is closed (on a Monday, as we found out by surprise) and you want some fish, at least this place is nearby.

Cons:
Fish just ain't that fresh, yo.

Fun:
There was a blowtorch that came out at one point--that's a good thing.
author: Mike G.

description: The daily happy hour offers generously sized, tasty rolls at supermarket sushi prices.  Not a swank date spot, but a good place to celebrate the end of a long day.
author: Vin J.

description: Sushi is not a cheap venture, so I'm a little pickier about it than eating at other places, because it's a treat. Sushi Raw is acceptable--the staff is very nice, it's close to home for me, the food is fresh. But it's not *really* good, enough for me to splurge on. The sashimi is cut super thick, which isn't my favorite texture, and I had to remind the waitress for things I already asked for (I never did get the low sodium soy sauce).
author: Tabitha L.

description: This is my guilty pleasure! Ok so I am trying to be a vegetarian as often as possible.... but when it comes to great sushi... I break my own rules! I love this place and treat myself and others here often. I have had to circle the block several times to find parking near this place and totally don't care.... this place rocks. I am in love with the ahi poki salad! I love there specialty rolls and saki!  They are hip and trendy and delicious!  Plus they are open pretty late all days... service is prompt and polite and food is fantastic... check them out for your sushi addiction :)
author: Celeste L.

description: I came here on my birthday. The sushi was super awesome and fresh and I loved their appetizers. Especially their grilled squid. The staff was also really friendly and my group of friends had a lot of fun.
author: Lawrence H.

description: there is not a single place in SF that makes ramen good enough for us....and this place seems to be especially disqualified with its very salty/instant noodle soup like broth,
author: Shuting Z.

description:
Delivery Sushi is a crap shoot, for sure, but with Sushi Raw, I most certainly crapped out.

The sashimi we ordered--the bulk of our order (admittedly a risky move for delivery)--was just bad. The salmon was not fresh, and beginning to take on undesirable flavors. The hamachi was a terrible cut--literally with connective tissue halfway through the piece. The seaweed salad was so rubbery and stale that I literally couldn't get passed the first bite.

I see a lot of positive reviews, so I assume the quality isn't always this poor. However, on this particular day it was inedible. We actually threw it out and went to the corner store and bought a box of Kraft Cheese & Macaroni.
author: Aiden B.

description: Pleasant & quick service and great sushi. Portions were good and exactly what I wanted.
author: Jason H.

description:
Ate lightly during my visit here, but still enjoyed myself. Got me some spicy tuna and an order of gyoza. Washed my food down with a large Saporro, which only cost $1.99 (was pleasantly surprised when I got my bill)!

The service is excellent: fast, kind, and attentive. A casual, attractive setting decorated with some unique artwork. Diggin' it.
author: azuré i.

description:
I'd rate this place higher if it was my neighborhood sushi stop, or if it wasn't as easy for me to get to superior restaurants, but the sushi and the service here are by no means bad. The nigiri is extremely well-priced, fresh and buttery, but not much else met my perfectly accessible standards.

Came to the restaurant to sit at the bar and have an indulgent meal with personal attention by a sushi chef. We got our bar seats, but not once during our stay were we actually tended to by the chef across the counter from us, who looked stressed out and hurried. We did receive good service by the hostesses, though as the night wore on and the place paced towards capacity, our service dwindled to the point that we almost reconsidered our post-roll follow-up of unagi and o-toro. Alas, we are sushi fiends, my boyfriend and I, and a bit of neglect didn't succeed in stopping us. 

We ordered the island roll and the jalapeño roll as the gist, with some saba and a seaweed salad to start us off. The menu is a little small as far as rolls go, and especially as far as rolls with only fresh, uncooked fish goes - many of the offerings included shrimp tempura or imitation crab meat. The rolls were unorthodox and tasty, but it should be noted on the menu that the jalapeño is cooked and that the island roll sits in a pool of vinegar. An interesting mouthfeel for the latter, my appreciation for it only took hold towards the final bite. 

This is a good spot to take groups of people, as most of the patrons belonged to large parties, and there's a raised section perfect for taking sake bombs.
author: Jake m.

description: Ok, so maybe rolls are not the thing to order here, or it has gone downhill since last time I came. The miso soup was too strong for me (red miso is not typical), and the rolls were nothing great. Perhaps most worrisome, my partner got a bit of what may have been food poisoning (although we ate all the same things, I have an iron stomach). Won't be coming back here unless I'm in the neighborhood and have exhausted all the other options.
author: Sam Z.

description:
All of the mixed reviews are interesting! I for one am a fan. A big fan. I was introduced to Sushi Raw during one of my weekly Grubhub sushi deliveries, and hands down it's consistently the best sushi delivery I've had (I've tried lots). And finding out that their restaurant is just a few blocks away made it even better. Service is warm and casual, and the waitresses keep the sake flowing. What more could you ask for?

In terms of the fish, I've stuck with omakase style nigiri and sashimi, or simple hand rolls, and I've never been disappointed with the quality or freshness. Will the sushi melt in your mouth in a more luxurious way if you're at Okoze? Sure. You'll also drop a benjamin at a place like that. Sushi Raw is my favorite neighborhood sushi joint with a fun vibe and good fish (and bottles of sake for $8), that will even walk my dinner up a flight of stairs if my lazy ass doesn't want to walk down Haight. Works for me.
author: Lisa P.

description:
Note: This rating is for delivery service only. I have never been to the restaurant itself.

Finally. A Japanese restaurant is good and delivers. Sushi Raw is registered on Grubhub.com. 

I imagine if I was served this food in a restaurant, then I would have given a 3 star rating. However, the added convenience of having someone bring my food to my doorstep is such a luxury. Sure, arguably, you can say that you pay for that in the cost of the food (prices are comparable to "dining out" because there is a $20 minimum which is a little tricky when you are ordering for one). But then you make fresh hamachi nigiri part of that order that just arrived at my doorstep and BAM! FOUR STARS! LOL. 

My order (for one person, but spread out into two meals):
hamachi kama -- a little more fatty than I'm used to but still quite tasty
2 piece hamachi belly nigiri -- yes, belly! yum!
chicken udon -- veggie selection could have been better but, to my surprise, they put in a lot of noodles and chicken
spicy sesame chicken -- batter is kind of boring but the spicy sesame dipping sauce makes up for it 
california roll (Free with any order over $25) -- it's a california roll. It was good. I don't normally order california rolls. *shrug*

Overall, I'm definitely going to be ordering from Sushi Raw again. Maybe next time a lot more hamachi. The only thing I'd probably skip next time is the udon.
author: Cat T.

description:
Enjoy coming here for the "happy hour" menu that they offer. Rolls that they offer on this menu is about $3-$4 off the regular price. And they offer hot sake or beer on the menu as well at a discount. 

If you prefer something else they do offer there bento plates. They taste good though  I think the portions in the bento is relatively small. That's just me:). Maybe next time I will order some appetizers or rolls on the side. 

They also have a ramen section on the menu for those craving it.
author: walleworld w.

description:
Hi!
Welcome!
Hello!
Hey there!
Come in!

That was the chorus of greetings as a walked in. Bit awkward. Either they love their customers, or they were bored. Other peeps were eating, so it wasn't like the joint was empty, so I think they really do love their customers. Still awkward.

Less so was the food, rather please pleased with the chopped yellowtail and green onion. Priced low, but there are only six pieces. Worth putting up with your own cheering section.
author: Jason B.

description:
This was by far the worst Sushi I ever had!
I am an avid Sushi fan, and came to San Francisco amongst other things to taste good sushi. This was a disgrace. The sushi was way too salty, the fish was definitively not fresh and the rices badly cooked.
author: R K.

description:
First time tonight. We had a mix of 4 rolls, 4 kinds of sashimi, and desert.

Service ***** (great!)
Sashimi ***** (mmmmm, buttery and fresh and quite good!)
Order of Unagai (2 pcs) - it was served cold...that bummed me out

Rolls, well the rolls were just okay. The fish was good, but, there just wasn't any *wow* to them. They have a Jalapeno Pepper role, and it wasn't crazy spicy, but, it also just didn't rock our world. The spicy tuna roll wasn't anything to write home about. The Walnut Prawn roll might have been my favorite, but again, just okay. Four Seasons roll, that was my favorite. Nice presentation. Nice taste.

Green Tea Cheesecake - nice taste
Mochi ice cream - mmmmmmmmmmmm! : - )

If you're in the hood and need/want sushi, go. They are so friendly and the service (water, tea, wine, saki, etc.) is go attentive, it makes for a very nice meal.
author: Mark M.

description: Went here for lunch recently.  The have good lunch specials which are around $10 (without drinks), and comes with miso soup and rice.  I tried the california rolls, avocado rolls and the shrimp tempura.  All were pretty good, but i actually liked the shrimp tempura the best because it was light, not very oily and not heavy like a lot of other tempura at other places.  Nice interior with a lot of seating inside. Fast & Friendly service.  I will probably come again to try out their other menu items.
author: Irfan R.

description:
I had a great date tonight which culminated at sushi raw... to match the theme of the date, well... sushi raw.  anyways, i have to say... this place hit the mark.  service was quick. the spicy tuna and salmon rolls were good.  the shrimp tempura rolls were lip smacking good.  the exquisite lobster rolls with mango rolled in thinly slice cucumber with caviar on top... well, i found it to refreshingly delicious.  AND i could sneak a peak at football on the big screen without my date seeing me peak at how dreadful my fantasy football team was doing.  i'd totally come back to this place again!  AND they take amex.  the only miss was their music selection (it went from celine dione's my heart will go on... titanic style... to country music selections... well, titanic style).  

Otherwise, I will certainly be back!  Cheers, Sushi Raw.
author: Alex D.

description: Price is reasonable. Highlight of the night is toro which was pretty good and only costs $9.9 for 2pcs! That's price for 1 at other places. People are very friendly too. It's my good toro fix on a budget.
author: argus Y.

description: This is our go-to place for delivery sushi.  Be prepared, its going to take an hour for delivery no matter when you order.  But its worth it.  There is so much bad sushi out there.  Sushi here is super fresh and they have a great variety.  Also, if you want something different, they are super flexible.  Rolls we love - 49er, Haight, Jalepeno, Spicy Tuna, Haight Street, and Swamp.  We even ordered a ton of sushi from here when our family from NY was in town, and they all commented on how good and fresh it was.
author: Jill G.

description:
We got delivery from here. Hooray for sushi delivery!

Since delivery sushi is usually iffy, we stuck with the simple stuff. I really enjoyed the hamachi belly nigiri! It was pretty tasty.

The spicy tuna here is not as awesome as at other places. The spicy to tuna ratio seems a bit off. Usually the spice compliments the tuna, but there's something about this that was a little off. HOWEVER, the deep fried spicy tuna that we also got was actually pretty delicious!

Also, not a lot of people have mentioned this, but they actually have a pretty decent selection of veggie rolls! They have some fancy ones like the Pink Lady and Sushi Raw veggie, and a deep fried asparagus. To clarify, the asparagus is deep fried, then made into a maki. The roll itself is not deep fried.

Why not 5 stars? A couple things.

-I ordered the tobiko roll with quail egg. The quail eggs arrived uncracked and I had quite a difficult time preparing this. I think they should have let me know about this when I was ordering.

-They put most of the sushi in one big tray, then smashed the wasabi and ginger in there. They smash the wasabi in so thoroughly that it completely covered one of the rolls, rendering it inedible. And this is coming from a person who can withstand a pretty decent amount of wasabi. I think they should have put the wasabi/ginger in a separate little to-go ramekin.
author: Rachel H.

description:
My standard go to for take out sushi in the hood.  Delivery time was usually pretty quick.   Freshness/quality decent for sashimi and they have some good rolls.

A couple of bad experiences lately with hour+ delivery and poor quality fish.  You know the distinct old fishy smell...

On the hunt for something between Domo and Sushi Raw.  Will let you know how it goes....
author: S M.

description: Adequately satisfied my bento lunch craving.
author: Adrian D.

description:
If you want traditional sushi, this is NOT your place. 

Didn't get a hot towel at the sushi bar (I asked for one and got a dampened paper towel), I ordered in Japanese but the waitress was Chinese, the edamame was insipid and cold, and I ordered from the waitress rather than the sushi chefs (who didn't make eye contact once). The sake (salmon) smelled fishy but tasted okay, the tuna was so chewy and stringy I couldn't bite through. The roll was okay. Oh, and the plate was chipped. 

Good parts: the ginger was phenomenal (I'm a ginger snob) and I got a free small bottle of sake.
author: Mi M.

description:
This is one of two sushi places within a block from our apartment and we eat here at least once a week. It's good quality fish and the price can't be beat. 

I tend to be a sushi purest and i love nigiri or sashimi and think that's the best way to rate a sushi restaurant. This is the kind of place where it's probably best to stick to the interesting roles. The nigirr isn't bad, but their rolls are better. 

My suggestion is the double hamachi roll. Also, if you order take out, make sure to ask for your free california roll (or spicy tuna roll, or softshell crab roll) when you order a $30 of food more. They put the coupons on their takeout menus and they never ask to see it. 

enjoy.
author: Philip H.

description:
Hello my dears! 

Joan here! I have to say the other night when i was coming back from a late-nighter (9pm) with the boys AND the booze. I stopped off at this inviting Sushi restaurant. I must say even though the vodka had already to start to impact my vision and tastebuds, I was very pleased with the sushi.

I indulged in the scrumptious Four Seasons Roll! I thought, I have had many one night stands in the Four Season hotel, why not try the roll as well! I reached almost the same levels of climax I did at the Four Season hotel after tasting the roll of the same name!

The waitstaff was so nice and friendly. My dear Kiki was a peach and she called cab for me and I headed off to my home, belly full of vodka and sushi, on my way home to check for wire hangers!

Bless You
Joan Crawford
author: Joan C.

description:
I walked in excited about the beer and sake special and left with a bad taste in my mouth like I got cheated in more than one way. 

The fish and food was somewhat tasty but the confusion the waitresses gave me on the prices and my orders were very frustrating.

When I first asked about the large beer and sake they said all were 1.99. Then second time around the other girl says every other one. Then the next waitress said something different. 

I also ordered a  live sea urchin which I was told it was 14 dollars. Then was charged 19. Then I order a small sashimi combo for 16 dollars, but they gave me the big one and charged me 22 dollars.

If it wasn't for all the mix up BS, I would've really liked this place and came back since I'm a SF haight/fillmore native. But after walking out with 100 dollars less in my pocket feeling screwed, all I can say now when someone asks me about this place is. "F*** that place.* 

ty.
author: Tip S.

description: I Like This Place A Lot & I Go here often with a bunch of my Friends and If you really want to Taste & Experience A Good Japanese Sushi and Enjoy a good Lunch or Dinner with your Family or Friends Definitely Go here and Try to Eat their Delicious Dish & Sushi's!!! For me, I usually like to order the Half Chicken, and Half Beef Terriyaki Combination Meal along w/ Side Salad w/ their special sauce & I also get a combination order order order of "Eil Rolls, California Rolls, and Dragon Rolls Sushi as part of my course meal so yeah!" This place is pretty good - the price is still affordable, the place is very chill, and you only wait for about 10-15 minutes on average to get your order... Also, make sure you try their japanese mango & green tea ice cream they have for desserts it was really good & overall this place is serve awesome food & the place is pretty decent - the servers are nice & pleasant people so yeah... Make sure you try eveything on the their menue each time you come here try a different dish or sushi & make sure eat the raw salmon with the teriyakl soy sauce is pretty tasty & very delicious y'all! Just keep an open mind & be spontaneous & courageous on your first sushi try & especially if you just want to eat your first japanese dish in your life - all I will tell you this type of Asian food & cultural meal is worth the try and I will definitely keep coming back for more japanese food!!! :)
author: Lawrence G.

description:
In a city full of good sushi places Sushi Raw just doesn't hold up.

I've ordered out a couple times and have been generally unimpressed with both quality and selection.

Lots of fried rolls and sauces, not what I like to order.  I've found both O-toro and Domo to be much better Sushi joints in this general neighborhood.
author: Mitch M.

description: Not the most amazing sushi restaurant I've been to in SF (shout to Sugoi, EIji, Ichi, and best ever sushi boat rockstars at Tenroku) BUT for delivery the quality and price and cannot be beat! Nigiri combo is awesome -- 8 pieces of nigiri for $15 along with soup and salad, very good quality and structure on the rolls too at $4-5 per roll. Also if you order from eat 24 you get a free california or spicy tuna roll. Solid and will definitely make this a regular thing for sushi on a quiet night in.
author: dr r.

description: We ordered delivery - came on time - and everything was accounted for. The complimentary California rolls were fantastic! The edamame barely salted which is a big no no. The grilled squid was tender and the dipping sauces were tasty. The seaweed salad was good but nothing new, and the gome-ae (sesame spinach) was good as well. The udon was lacking flavor - and barely had any vegetables in it - so thats why I'm docking this place some points. It was all okay, good, but nothing knock my socks off - not memorable I guess but reliable delivery so I can't complain.
author: S. M.

description:
When my wife and I first moved into the Lower Haight, we went to the nearest sushi restaurants, hoping to find a place we could regularly blow a disproportionate amount of my salary on raw fish. 

I love sushi; when I was a kid, my mom would take us out for it, like, twice a year, and she would make me eat a sandwich at home first. Because otherwise, I could eat the month's family food budget in one sitting as a teen. 

So the local place needed to be good. Not great, but good. First came Hanabi. The tuna was eh, the salmon was less than eh, and the halibut actually turned my stomach. The interior feels dilapidated, a little dirty, and definitely old. Bummer. Never went back. Next was Amasia's Hides, which has the distinction of running a 50% special on sake. Every day. The fish was all eh. I remember getting the tobiko and feeling like it tasted like finely ground gravel. Never went back.

Next up were Sushi Time and Domo; both are fantastic, among the best in the city (up there with Shimo, thank you Danny Ronen).

Sushi Raw is the middle ground. It isn't as fabulous as Domo, but that  restaurants (and Sushi Time and Eiji, another great one) each seat about 12 people, max. Sushi Raw seats closer to 50. The waitresses are really cute - the first time I went it was Halloween and they were all in ears and tails. The fish is good; I had excellent Salmon last time. The spicy tuna is a little too much on the spicy and flavorless side. The 49er roll is good. The double hamachi has too much mayo. And its probably less expensive than Domo, about the same as Sushi Time. 

The interior is nice, the service prompt (and cute), and this place beats the s%&t out of Iraqi food. I mean, what the hell was that place, anyway? So to review, in Duboce/Lower Haight/Hayes Valley/N. Castro Sushi choices, it goes:
1) Domo
2) Sushi Time
3) Sushi Raw
4) Barracuda
5) Amasia's Hides
6) Everything else in walking distance
7) Hanabi

Its worth going to.
author: Mark G.

description: Sushi Raw is a great neighborhood sushi joint. Given that I live just across the street from them, I end up getting their food to-go most days.  Their rolls are delicious. I'm a huge fan of their House Special Ramen, as well as their BBQ Eel bento box dinner.  Every roll that I've gotten here has been absolutely solid as well.   Check them out!
author: Andy J.

description: Other than 2 for one beers, nothing special.
author: Michael E.

description:
If you are a vegan/vegetarian and your friends want sushi, INSIST on going to Sushi Raw.  HOLY MOLY.  If you are tired of boring raw vegetables wrapped in rice and seaweed, typical of every sushi place I have ever been to you MUST come to Sushi Raw and be prepared for some amazing delights.  Flip to the back of the menu to the vegetarian section.  

THE BEST Veg roll - the Pink Lady.  This is a roll wrapped in light pink soy paper and shaped like a dew drop.  They place 4 dew drops next to each other to form 2 little pink hearts, and the rest of the dew drops are served in a martini glass - I kid you not.  Inside these little gems you will find tempura asparagus, mushroom carrot, sweet potato, and mango...and swirled on your plate for your dipping pleasure is a sweet mango sauce that is literally to die for.  This roll is not made for soy sauce so don't ruin your experience by using it!  Simply savor the sweetness of the roll you have rightfully chosen, feel special because your fish-eating friends do not get their sushi served in a martini glass, and get full because its really big and so worth the higher price.

One time I ordered the Swamp Roll which, when compared to the Pink Lady is just ok.  But really nothing can compare to that thing, so if you are into a more savory (soy sauce dipping) roll this is for you.  Its got sweet potatoes on the inside and seaweed salad on top...shaped like a little caterpillar and also comes with sauce on the plate.  

The only reason I give 4 stars is because the service can be really slow, unless its the end of the night - then they are super fast.  

Also, their happy hour is amazing. (although sadly no veg options are included)

VEGAN PINK LADY FOR LIFE!!!!
author: Mere H.

description: I ate in the other night and really enjoyed it.  The food is so fresh and the servers are really nice.  The place is a lot bigger than I thought too.  We got 4 rolls, tuna poke, the tempura app, 2 large saporos, 2 large sakes, and it was around $80 with tip.  During happy hour, you get a second large beer or sake for $.99 or $1.99.  Several of their rolls are $2-3 off as well.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
There are not many sushi options in Lower Haight, but thankfully this one delivers. This place sits where Baghdad Nights used to be; too bad I never tried Nights out before it went the way of the dodo. Checked it out  during the Lower Haight Art Walk this past week and was happily surprised. Disclaimer: I have lost my passion for sushi and this is the first time I eat sushi in a very long time.

Ambiance (4): It could have been the art walk going on, but the energy was nice and everybody seemed happy to be there. That to me is always a good sign; good food = happy people. Lots of art on the wall, great marble/granite/something bar that you don't actually mind sitting at, and nothing pretentious about it.

Food (4): I love grilled squid and when this shows up in the menu, it's getting ordered. The key to grilled squid is that it has to taste good without the aioli/mayo sauce, otherwise it's crap dressed up with fat. Mind you, if there is sauce, something will get dipped and I did dunk some rolls into it. Don't call out blasphemy, just yet, plenty of the rolls are topped with sauce at a lot of modern sushi joints. We had some eel/avocado rolls, some spicy tuna and more tuna on top rolls, and some eel/cream cheese rolls, and they were all great. 

The specialty rolls all have fancy names and the presentation is nice, bordering on a little over the top, but they tasted good so I did not mind it at all. We did not have any sashimi, but I appreciated that the little storage compartment had a thermometer showing the temp which makes you a little more certain that they are keeping the stuff at the right temp. For dessert we had mochi and green tea cheesecake. Both solid, nothing extraordinary, but I find the subtle flavors suitable for a Japanese restaurant and don't need some over the top raspberry shenanigans to end my meal.

Service (3): Could have used more attention and the constant swapping of who helped us out I found disconcerting.

Value (4): Good prices and they had a 2-for-1 beer deal that sure helped massage the bill. Overall tab was about 50 for two large beers, 2 specialty rolls, 1 regular roll, 1 squid, 2 desserts. Good value in my book.

Overall: I am very happy to have tried out some really good restaurants in the Lower Haight area that really make it stand out as one of the best SF neighborhoods. Along with Acme Burgerhaus, RNM, the Grind Cafe, Raja, and others, this is one of the restaurants in the Lower Haight area that are going into the regular rotation.
author: Alvaro H.

description:
Kind of amazing how when you walk in the door everybody who works there turns to shout Hi! (in Japanese).  I went in to order takeout and they offered me green tea while i was waiting (soo nice as it was bitchass cold that day).  My sushi rolls were really good!

The ambiance is okay- it's pleasant inside, the only prob is it's just too damn big. even with a fair number of customers the place looks empty because it's so large.  Good luck newbies to the Haight!
author: Hella M.

description:
Irrashaimase!!

My boyfriend and I got a craving for sushi and wanted to find it fast. After work, we hopped on the J and found our way over to Haight.
