They're still running their Grand Opening special at Sushi Raw, but we didn't want 2 for 1 (or even 1 for 1) hot sake. The bill was 10% off, though, which I basically just gave back to the restaurant in the form of extra tip... er... anyway. I tip generously, maybe compulsively so.

Our waitress and all other staff were friendly and attentive. I love the metal binding on the menus. Just noticed on my way out that it matches the doorway, too, and some of the other restaurant decor. Industrial chic seems like a strange contrast with cherry blossoms, especially for a Japanese restaurant and in this neighborhood, but hey, if it works for them, right?

I sipped some miso soup. It's ordinary miso soup that you would get in most restaurants, but it's yummy. (I'm glad whenever they don't give you a spoon. You're supposed to sip it from the bowl like a giant tea cup!) We split the dragon roll and the spicy salmon roll, which were both your fairly standard westernized rolls, but done very well. We also split a stunning Eclipse roll that stood up in an impressive arc shape on the plate. The special rolls aren't that expensive here, and the chefs put a lot of effort into the presentation (as it should be, right?).

I accidentally startled a waitress who brought us the bill too early, because I had ordered tiramisu and I was confused when she brought me something other than food. I felt so bad for bluntly interrupting her! She looked so sad =( I found the tiramisu forgettable, but it's not my favorite dessert, so I don't really want to hold that against them.
author: Sharon W.

description: After years of just lurking on yelp, it is this restaurant that moved me to create an account and post a review. The quality  has plummeted since it opened a year or two ago to the point where the sushi was basically inedible the last time we got take out. The salmon was scary mealy and the tuna tasted like slimy wood. Literally, the worst I have ever (not) eaten.
author: Steven H.

description: I live two blocks away from here and I've been here many times.  Somehow I only just discovered their happy hour! Sushi deals and great beer and sake deals too! The red dragon roll is amazing!  The sushi is not the best i've ever had but it's pretty darn good.  I have also had their ramen which was pretty good.  Service was good too, we were not rushed out and were able to sit and talk as long as we wanted after finishing our meal.  This place is worth checking out.
author: Julie B.

description: This is my go-to delivery sushi place. We regularly order sushi for six or so for events at the house and are always stunned by the speed and quality. They are magicians. Thanks guys! Always a customer.
author: Jason P.

description:
The menu is enormous. A novella, and well bound. Good size Sake list complete with pictures, they have hot and cold food, or shall I say raw, cold and hot food. The staff are very sweet and answer any questions you might have.

The food was really good. The fish was clearly fresh, (caught this morning) the presentation was lovely. The Lovers Roll is aptly named. Delicious!

The grand opening prices are very good. 

It was really hard to hear in there, the ambiance was a bit tense, but I loved the art. Very surreal. I'll be going back for more.

Sorry Hanabi...
author: Marz W.

description:
Was a little sad that I didn't go to Baghdad Nights while it was still open, but psyched about another Asian joint within walking distance. Overall, the fish quality and service exceeded my expectations. So glad to have another option in the area besides Hanabi (which is decent, but not fantastic). 

A more detailed breakdown:

Great:
"Lover's roll" (spicy tuna with albacore on the outside): 5 stars. Albacore was melt in your mouth delicious, and overall the balance was very nice. They even did black/orange alternating roe for Halloween :) 

Two for one beers - awesome

Service - attentive and generally good 

Not too bad:
I felt like someting heartier too, so split a chicken teriyaki rice place with the bf. The chicken was a little bland, and nothing to write home about, but serviceable. (Miso, salad, etc. was nice) 

Rock and roll -- not as good as the other roll, a little tiny bit chewy. 

The ambiance was a little bit weird, though welcoming. It's a great space, with a slightly elevated mezzanine beyond the tables in the front and the bar. I say weird because they have some beautiful Asian decor, like a huge cherry blossom branch behind the sushi bar, but then an eclectic collection of paintings on the wall leading up to the mezzanine. I can only describe the paintings as some sort of collective pop culture subconscious run through a Salvadore Dali filter. 

Anyway, overall very impressed and looking to coming back again. (prob just stick to beer and more sashimi-heavy fare next time)
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I just got back from dinner at Sushi Raw in the lower Haight.  The last time we tired to eat there, we saw they were open but by the time we had found parking, they were closed!  So this time, we left the car and walked in to see what specials come with their "Grand Opening".  Two-for-one drinks were nice, but not enough to convince me to make it a habit.

First of all, the fish is very fresh.  I tried the Maguro (tuna), Hamachi (yellow tail) and Sake (salmon) and each were expertly prepared.  At $4.50 for a pair of each, you get what you pay for.  Sushi Raw is a tad on the expensive side, but at least they deliver on quality.  The cheif was very nice and offered us a range of "special" fish and rolls, but we couldn't really figure out what they were. I tend not to stray into mackerel and shellfish territory anyway, but he did seem to have many fresh specials.

They have some very artful rolls.  We tried the Dragon, and the Haight Street Roll, both were very good.  The bento box comes on an artful plate, is a good helping of food, and comes with a salad and miso.

Some sushi bars present masterful blends of fresh fish, art, and flavors to produce the best sushi.  Sushi Raw blends good food with a good atmosphere to serve up a good dinning experience that fits the price.  

I would recommend Sushi Raw to anyone with a little bit of money to spend who enjoys fresh fish, modern art, and a friendly and helpful staff who shout "Irrashaimase!" (welcome!) to everyone who walks in the door.
author: T. M. B.

description:
Cool, cozy spot in Lower Haight. Their sushi is fresh, and the service is great.  Between my gf and I, we had a seafood salad (good), sea bass bento (good), uni (nope, they ran out), salmon skin hand roll (just okay, since it wasn't a hand roll like i requested, but I ate it anyway), and a double hamachi roll (AWESOME). 

Overall, its a good place to eat to grab sushi in Lower Haight.
author: Lyndon M.

description: Been 2.5 hours (that's right, two hours and thirty minutes) and STILL waiting for my dinner delivery order! The restaurant is exactly two miles from my house and I ordered enough for four people. My out of town guests are now going to have to drive back home very late on a Sunday night. I just called the restaurant and they apologized and said they would give me a free $3.50 edamame on my next order to make up for it. Gee thanks.
author: Joan L.

description: The chicken teriyaki was very good and I would highly recommend it to others. The bento box seems fairly large and filling too.
author: Abhi M.

description: Love this place! The food is always fantastic as well as the service!, they most definitely have a regular customer with my roommates and I!
author: Francesca H.

description:
I was so excited to see another sushi place open in  the Lower Haight that I created an Yelp account just to write a review of Sushi Raw's Haight Street location.  

Yummmmmmmmmmm. I went here with two of my girlfriends and had a GREAT experience.  The prices were super reasonable, the sushi was yummy, and the wait staff was kind and attentive. We shared several rolls and hot sake between us and ended the night with green tea and mango mochi (my favorite part of the meal).  The  rolls weren't huge so next time I might order a little bit more food to share.  
 If you hurry over there now you'll get to take advantage of their "Grand Opening" 10% discount and 2 for 1 Beer and Hot Sake specials.  
I will definitely be back here and might even bring my picky-eater of a boyfriend who hates sushi but could benefit from Sushi Raw's noodle and teriaki dishes for those not as keen on the raw fish.
author: Kristin W.

description:
You kids are crazy picky in your reviews. Calm down and enjoy the food.

Speaking of, the food was fantastic. Just fantastic. And well priced. Get a special roll. They are so intrinsic that it will feel like you ordered multiple wonderful rolls that go well together. 

The atmosphere was great: went in on Easter to friendly 20 somethings yelling "HAPPY BIRTHDAY JESUS!" The waitress laughs, we laugh, and we all drink our (delicious) sake. 

The service was fantastic, you just have to actually ASK for the bill.  Big woop. 

Not a romantic date place. But above par regardless.
author: Emily S.

description:
First of all - as a former reviewer for The Onion and various Google sites, there is a known rule that you never review a new Restaurant it's first week, that's just not fair. So if you are reading reviews look carefully at the dates as they only opened in the fall of 2009.

A great time to come here is lunch time: I save a bundle, it's nice and quiet, and the sushi is made fast and fresh (and free edamame). Dinner is great too as the servers are very friendly.

While dining here with my - we will call him my God Son - the waitress asked him (he is 7) if he was all done or would he like some ice cream? He replied "First I have to take a poo and then I'll let you know," and winked at her making a fake trigger with his hand before running off to the bathroom. I was mortified, the waitress kept her cool. Thank you kind waitress!

As for the sushi - delicious, delicious, delicious. I like it all. Yes, all of it (the only kind I don't eat is egg) 

* The sake deal also rocks - buy one get one free
author: nicole m.

description: I really enjoy this sushi place near my house. The service is great and the sushi hits the spot every time. Will be back.!
author: Chad C.

description:
Chain prices, independent quality.

Everything is incredibly fresh, and you get quite a lot with your meal. Love the edamame snacks. Very fresh.Tempura batter is very well done, not too thick. But of course, the sushi is outstanding.

I can't imagine Hanabi down the street will stay in business much longer....
author: Mark A.

description: Mackerel, salmon, rainbow roll, rock n roll, baked oysters and two large hot sakes on a Tuesday night. The fish is fresh, the rice is good quality and the sake is inexpensive. Total price - $35. Not bad.
author: Corey V.

description:
Fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I love this place!!!

My boyfriend and I visited Sushi Raw a month or so ago and I've been back numerous times since.   To start with, the staff are extremely friendly and attentive and the interior decor is very welcoming.  

The sashimi is extremely fresh and the menu itself is extensive. They have an excellent selection of exotic rolls. The Four Seasons roll is one of my favorites (eel, avocado, crab & tuna).  The Lobster roll was also fantastic and so was the Eclipse roll.  I also recommend the Haight Street roll, the Dragon roll and the Rainbow roll and the Lion King Roll is a must have.  

For appetizers, we tried the rainbow shrimp (prawns wrapped with bacon). It was delicious although the order was a little on the small side to share between two people.  The tempura plate was also good and I've had the salmon teriyaki bento box which was very tasty.  

I'm sure I'm forgetting some other dishes but I've found everything to date to be phenomenal.  I eat a lot of sushi and I rank Sushi Raw as one of the best in the city and the prices are very reasonable!!
author: Clare C.

description:
Sushi Raw has awesome food, the only problem is that the service is somewhat okay (the waitresses are pretty much all asian and have thick accents that you don't really understand), not that great. It takes a while sometimes for them to take your order; depends on how busy it is.

The food is awesome, fresh etc, however... the pricing. I can go to some cheap sushi bar and get cheaper sushi than here.

It's good, but not great.
author: Monique K.

description: I got take out which probably is never a good idea for sushi, but it didn't taste fresh at all. I was really disappointed. One star for quick service and one star for reasonable prices. One of the rolls I ordered tasted so off that I was afraid I might get sick if I finished it. I don't know why I keep trying other places. Tokyo go-go, Amasia Hide's Sushi Bar, and Sushi Time are still my favorites.
author: Melissa V.

description: High quality and low prices. Don't miss the happy hour! (till 7pm) I live in Japantown but I'm definitely coming back for my sushi craves.
author: Anthony M.

description:
What to expect: good quality fish, buy 1 get 1 free beer or sake, complimentary edamame, colorful pop art on walls, sweet waitresses (maybe over solicitous, actually). 

Such a welcome entrant to Lower Haight. I had a smackingly good salmon teriyaki bento box which included light, crispy tempura.

The tempura udon's good but not excellent. The broth skews oddly a bit sweet, not salty as I like, but the actual tempura goods are done well.
author: enmi k.

description:
Very average. I'd go with a 2-star rating, but since they're new, I'll bump 'em up one in hopes that they make improvements. The sushi is average at best and the ambiance is well, kinda terrible. It has that American mall, trying to be hip decor feel. Just very stale overall.

The service is good but a bit too much. I know they're early on, but you don't need to stop by every two minutes and having every server in the place attend to me (not one came back twice) only upped the stale feel. 

Boy do I miss Hanabi. They had wonderful sushi at a great price and TONS of character. And the music was always classic.
author: K F.

description: Ok so I've already explained how good the sushi is here.... like the Double Hamachi roll that never ever gets old. It always tastes amazing every single time.  This last time we went we decided to get their buy one sake/beer and get the second for .99 (if small). It's easy to get your buzz on for super cheap! The guys at the bar next to us definitely purchased many buy one get one cheap deals, because they were beyond gone. LOL good times at sushi!
author: Sonya D.

description:
After all these years of hanging in the Lower Haight, I didn't even know there was a sushi joint in the 'hood.  And on top of that, it's huge!

I had the chef's choice sashimi platter, which your usual three pieces each of tuna, salmon, yellowtail and halibut.  Nothing to complain about, really.  Was amazed at how quickly it came out (and then I noticed about five people working behind the sushi counter).

The free edamame is a nice touch. 

The menu is huge ... from rolls to teriyaki to ramen.  Haven't tried any of those yet but will keep in mind for next time.
author: F. P.

description:
I would not come back.  Ironically, the only good thing on the menu is cow's tongue, which was neither sushi nor raw.   The nigiri is really bland.  A lot of the rolls are covered in mayonnaise sauces.

Baghdad Nights was much better, and more interesting.
author: Neil G.

description:
It was hot as blazes tonight, but I was hankering for some sushi. I walked up the many blocks to get to Sushi Raw, first time I'd been there although they have been about 8-10 blocks up from where I live for 2 years, apparently. 
 I went during 'happy hour'. Hell, I was happy! But happier still to learn that the hot sake and some sushi dishes were offered at a lower price because of 'happy hour'.  Despite the heat, the sushi was most excellent, and the chefs very accomodating. As good as the sushi was, the service was even better. Perhaps it was because it was 'happy hour', perhaps the service is ALWAYS this good. Mendy was my main waitress and was always there when I needed her, and off doing other things when I didn't. Her friendly engagement,  the light resulting from the sake, and the excellent sushi made it a fantastic venture.  I won't hesitate to return. I recommend it to anyone coming down to or living in the lower Haight.
author: daniel k.

description:
Be there last Monday nite, with my family. Our waitress were friendly and attentive. 
I order live scallop, that's GREAT! very yummi and fresh, we have scallop sashimi and little tempar thing, is good! We order 3 rolls. The Four Seasons roll is really good  combination of tuna, avocado, unagi, and a ton of mayonnaise. I can see why people like this roll.^^ However, the Mt. Fuji roll was amazing!!  It includes lobster, mango, and topped with scallops. I really liked this roll and would definitely get it again. last order is Eclipse roll.  It  stood up in an impressive arc shape on the plate.Very well presentation! (have to try!)
author: virginia y.

description:
Get your news here- we've got a good sushi in the lower haight! 

Leave the eclectic Haight  sidewalk and enter a well lit sushi joint that extends to the back and is separated into two levels. As your smiling hostess walks you through the narrow restaurant  to your table you'll see fresh sushi rolled and hear the latest Lady Gaga on repeat. 

The sushi was good and well priced. I definitely recommend the Four Seasons. The presentation was beautiful. 

I wouldn't recommend the house salad, it wasn't the traditional salad I was expecting. 

Wish I had known about the free edamame, that would have been clutch.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Sushi Raw is one of my favorite restaurants!! The service is awesome, the waitresses are always so nice and Its such a warm and friendly place. The food also great, fish is pretty fresh, and I love their specialty rolls. My favorite is the four seasons roll and the fuji mountain.  They light that one on fire, its pretty cool.  They also have a great happy hour selection with cheaper prices off of some rolls and beer and sake!!!
Delivery service is also great, get my food on time and fresh. 

Bottom line, this place rocks!!
author: Jamie S.

description: Really?  How long has it been since the wall to wall carpet in this place was clean?  Don't answer that, as I just ate there and I'm afraid my delicious bowl of House Special Ramen will come up and further soil the carpet.  Clean this place up. For God's sake!  You're serving raw fish.
author: WhatDoIKnow S.

description:
They yell at you in Japanese when you enter the door. As a stealth ninja, it is disheartening.  I hear,  "You forget to make your bed, go home!"  Now the whole neighborhood knows I eat sushi by myself with a book in hand. 
Food is good- some of their combinations are too interesting, cream cheese and mayonaise have no place is sushi restaurant.  I am glad  Sushi Raw is in my neighborhood.
author: Kathleen G.

description: I used to love eating here........until their Chirashi recently gave me a nasty bit of food poisoning. Never going here again.
author: Cleo W.

description: Can't speak for the service or the restaurant because we got it to go. Decent sushi. The spicy tuna roll was really spicy and yummy! The Philly roll was not that good, California was O.K. Not too steep prices for sushi, either. I'm sure there are better places in the city, but it's perfect for a night in or to satisfy a craving without costing you an arm and a leg.
author: christine c.

description:
My husband and I are pleased that there is a better sushi option in Lower Haight than Hanabi, however, we've definitely had better.  

We were immediately greeted by everyone which put a big smile on our faces.  The menu was quite varied.  I ordered Hamachi, Suzuki, Onaga and Saba. My husband got the sea bass marinated in miso.  The staff was flexible and made me a roll that was not on the menu.  The sushi was decent... I am sorry to say it was nothing special.  However, we will be going back because of the price, location, and very friendly staff.  

Be sure to come with your own chop sticks as they use disposable sticks.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
I was excited when I saw that a new sushi place would be opening - despite the fact that the name is extremely generic - I still had hope.

I tried to overlook the fact that the menu looks as though it was printed off of a Japanese site for "How to Open a Sushi Restaurant in America".

And that the ambiance was awful and our waitress had zero personality.

Then they delivered complimentary edamame ... which surprised me ... especially since it was served in a metal bread basket! It's almost as if they bought the restaurant and all of the accoutrements from Baghdad Nights! 

After we ate the stale compliments, they cleared our plates by dumping the empty shells back into the bread basket and replacing the plates in front of us -  rather than clearing the plates away altogether. I'm all for conserving water, but I'm also paying for an experience.

Then the house salad arrived. I almost cried when I saw what looked like Italian dressing on the salad. Thankfully, it was not! 

We ordered three rolls--my friend is new to sushi so we did not try any nigiri or sashimi, etc. The rolls were decent, though I felt the spicy tuna was rolled in far too much rice and the spider roll was drenched in too much sauce. The 49er's roll had teeny slices of orange on top ... one or two of which still had seeds. OOPs!

AND
Upon going to use the restroom, I saw that said stale edamame was sitting in an open plastic bucket at the waiter station. Yuck.
author: A S.

description:
For the lower haight, it is great. I have been to waaaay better sushi spots. But this place is ok if you really want sushi and don't want to go far. I live by here so they deliver too. Sushi is consistent

The one thing that that annoyed me though is they don't have REAL crab. Every time I ask them they say "We don't have real crab, tonight." As if to say that somehow their crab delivery didn't make it that day. When I ask again (on a Sat night), and they same the same thing, I basically come to the conclusion that they are full of it and are blowing weed vapors up my a$$. 

SUMMARY: Decent enough, and close to home, so I will come here from time to time. But you won't find me here if I am craving the REAL DEAL sushi.
author: Rouz E.

description:
Hooray for yummy sushi in the Lower Haight!  And for great service-my nails were still drying from a manicure when I went to pick up my order and the lady walked me to the front door and opened it for me so I wouldn't ruin my nails.

I've only been here a couple of times but I like the vibe of this place. I agree that the service is a tad over-attentive, but other than that I have no bones to pick. The sushi is good (try the 49er roll!) and I love that they have grilled squid (soooo delicious).
author: Sushi S.

description: Last Saturday I had a total dinner emergency!  My boss decided to cancel his dinner reservation for 10 people and asked me to order in sushi... he wanted to impress his friends and have the food there fast.  I started to panic!  Then, I called Sushi Raw on Haight for a last minute order.  My budget was $300 and I had to please my picky boss and his guests.  I did not even have a copy of the menu, I just asked them to send  their best rolls. WOW.  They delivered 35 creative, fresh, colorful rolls beautifully arranged on party platters- all in about one hour!  They called to check in and make sure we were happy and the delivery got there so quickly.  I was always a fan of the sushi here, but in addition to the great food the service is wonderful!  Thank you!
author: R G.

description: I personally prefer the other location. The presentation and quality of food is consistent but ambiance is better at the Mission location.
author: M R.

description: I went here for lunch and basically just found it by walking by. The place was empty and the waitress clearly seemed to be bored. She wasn't rude or anything but clearly counted the hours to be off....I sat by the sushi bar and saw the fish, it did not look very fresh so I opted for a lunch box with a California roll, sweet potato roll, chicken teriyaki and rice. The rice was kind of hard, the chicken was cold and the roll were ok but not rolled properly. The food tasted ok but I wouldn't have wanted to try the fish that had been sitting in the sushi bar. Definitely not going back unfortunately.
author: Marie F.

description:
I just went to Sushi Raw for the first time last night.
And I had a great time.
Some basic facts: They have buy one beer/sake and get second for $2. A pretty sweet deal.
We had: grilled squid-- pretty good, but much better if you ask grinded fresh ginger to go with it. Tempura-- very solid. Baked oysters--not my favorite, I have had better. Seafood salad-- quite average. 49er Roll--very delicious. Spicy Tuna Roll-- very good as well. 
What gets me the most (in a good way) is their excellent service. Everyone was very friendly, that includes the sushi chefs, too. The place is very comfortable (I was sitting at the sushi bar). Did I mention the price is very reasonable?
author: Mike S.

description:
The server we had Mandy I believe was awesome and very attentive! The food was pretty decent and the beer/sake special was pretty awesome.  
However at the end of the night our waitress said she could split the bill for us and she had some issues with that and they fired her right there.  just for that i wouldn't go back. . . the vibe was sorta weird in there between the staff.  i would recommend another sushi place....
author: crys c.

description:
When they first opened I thought it would be the answer to my quick sushi fix, and it was for awhile but there are times I walk in and it smells a little fishy. One time I watched them pull a pre-made California Roll from their work area and use it in my order. Hum..... 
And then there was tonight when  I was desperate and found out that they recently decided to set a 15$ credit card minimum purchase!?! Who does that? I understand 5 or 10$ but 15$ is a little high in my opinion. (My bill was 13$) I don't carry lots of cash and this was kind of the last straw for me. Sorry, I'll be walking the extra distance for great sushi!
author: Sarah D.

description: Tasty and very fresh sushi at reasonable prices. For takeaway, I can recommend the sushi-sashimi combo (comes with so-so salad and good miso-soup).
author: Michael F.

description: My favorite delivery sushi in san francisco . I am a new father and they have satisfied my sushi lust for the last year, as it is not as easy as it once was to go out and get food.Because of you sushi raw I still get to have sushi without dealing with a baby sitter!
author: D M.

description: come to happy hour here before 7pm and have 2 for 1 beer and sake! I enjoyed my cold Sapporo in a chilled mug and felt very happy ; )
author: Laura F.

description: I love this place because I LOVE sushi and it's a few blocks from my house. I like the atmosphere. The interior of the restaurant has two levels and I enjoy sitting on the second level. The sushi is delicious and I particularly love their Ikura. Whether dining in or getting take out this place has quick friendly service. One thing that I don't appreciate is that they have a TV mounted in the corner. I think TV's in restaurants are a distraction and they give me the willies, however this one is tucked away and not too horrible.
author: Masha S.

description: i had the teriyaki chicken which was awesome and smoked and grilled the way i like it. My friend did teriyaki salmon bento box with some sushi he really enjoyed. The atmosphere is cute, the staff is slow as hell...5 people standing around doing nothing...it took a half hour to get the check and it was not busy. But , we like the food and the presentation was gorgeous. They are good with special orders, too.
author: christie m.

description: This place is pretty awesome. The staff is great. Sake and beer deals are amazing. Sushi is above normal but not the best I've ever had.. This is my favorite place to go when friends are in town or for bday parties.. They used to display local artists work on the walls and the lights used to be brighter.. Maybe new owners? Anyway, still a great place, nice atmosphere and a fabulous ambiance. Thanks again neighbor.
author: Mae B.

description:
This is the first and last time we will ever order sushi here. We ordered delivery and the sashimi was not fresh. The hamachi was seriously chewy and the salmon (sake) didn't taste like sake. The spicy tuna roll was extremely spicy which I'm guessing is to cover up from not fresh tuna. The fried chicken was cold and the tempura coating was soggy.

Literally couldn't even get past the first bite of each fish and now have stomach cramps.

Overall, a waste of $40.
author: Jennifer K.

description: I've only had takeout from here. However, the staff is always super friendly. They greet you when you walk in, are prompt at taking your order, and make sure you have water or tea while you wait. The food isn't the best I've ever had, but it's still pretty good. For their rice plate dinner entrees, I wish they had a brown rice option. On a positive note, if you want vegetarian sushi, their selection is pretty good.
author: Damon P.

description: I've been here like 5 times, since I live close by and always ask myself after why did I just go there. The sushi isn't great but the restaurant is nice and the staff is friendly. I order Spicy Tuna, Hamachi Nigiri and a seaweed salad (and some other stuff) and was kinda grossed out by the sushi. It tasted a bit fishy, which hamachi never really does, and didn't feel fresh or of high quality.
author: Eric K.

description: This place has gone downhill, much to our disappointment. The raw fish tasted like it had been frozen and thawed, nor did it have a good texture. Pet peeve of mine: the lettuce they used in the house salads was brown around the edges. Not going back nor will we have it delivered again.
author: Mara K.

description: This is the best delivery sushi I've ever had.  Fresh fish, big portions, fair prices and super quick delivery - Sushi Raw is fantastic.  It's so good it's kindof a problem... I now order $30 delivery once a week.  Am I the only one who eats leftover sushi?
author: Matt S.

description:
Well, let me tell you... I was not a happy camper when I saw a Japanese restaurant open up blocks from my dear Hanabi (R.I.P). I thought it was worth a try but as I walked in I knew we'd have a complicated relationship. Sure, the 2-for-1 beer & sake special is awesome! However, it's not so awesome when you can't even flag down the wait staff to tell them a half hour after ordering that they forgot your drinks. To Sushi Raw's defense, they seem slammed. I went on a Sunday night and the wait time was approx 15 mins. It was the kind of situation where the staff greets you kindly, sits you down asap, and then ignores you when you want to order and receive your food.
As far as the sushi, it was pretty good! -  better than Hanabi's.... but for me, what matters more is the soup (the RAMEN, specifically). Sushi Raw only has 1 type of ramen and it is rather underwhelming. I learned from the Hanabi owners that the owners of Sushi Raw are Korean, not Japanese. I have no idea if this would  influence the taste/style but It's kinda interesting, right?
I may try Sushi Raw again, but I'm betting the new Japanese place that's opening where Hanabi was is going to be my ramen sanctuary!
author: Nicole L.

description: I don't get all the 3 star reviews for this new sushi place. Strictly speaking in terms of food & quality, it was all really great & reasonably priced. I was pleasantly surprised with the Hamachi Sashimi, which was really soft and cut perfectly. Yes, the ambiance is a little too up beat for the area, but I actually enjoyed the different atmosphere. On a Saturday by 7:00 PM the place was packed, the Beer & Sake were flowing and everyone seemed to be enjoying their meals.
author: Cindy H.

description: Definitely not authentic, but definitely not bad either.  Not my style, but I do believe it is a roll lovers paradise.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Great food!

try the eclipse roll its amazing!  

Decent prices...
author: Shannon L.

description: Yeah so I finally got around to eating here. Before I'd just ordered in. Very good experience, man it was jumping off I almost didn't feel like I was in the Lower Haight. Good food, good vibe, not at all expensive the staff were solid. A+ This place is in my neighborhood and I can definitely see bringing out of towners here and them having a blast.
author: Klik W.

description: A great sushi spot, has the melt in your mouth type of taste!
author: Drew F.

description: I was excited to check out this spot for the happy hour special of 50% off certain rolls and the buy one sake, get one for 99 cents is a good deal.  Opted for the Nigiri chefs choice platter but some of the cuts were questionable.  I was really disappointed and thought a lot of the cuts were really unfresh.  The texture was off and they tasted and smelled really fishing and were even a little tough to eat.  I've eaten a fair share of sushi to know better and will not be going back here again.
author: Lisa L.

description: The sushi is great, the prices are decent, and my daughter LOVES to come here because the people are friendly and kid around with her.  If a place wins over my five-year old, we're coming back over and over again.
author: Brian H.

description:
I do not know if it drives anyone crazy when a Japanese Sushi restaurant  is nothing more than a poor stab at sushi hiding behind "we are really a Chinese staffed and actually run a terrible 
 Japanese styleSushi Restaurant.  They do not have even one Japanese sushi chef.  Believe it or not they can't even make delicious sushi rice.  I just think they are pretending to be a sushi restaurant.  You know sometimes we like to go out but I can tell you I can make delicious sushi rice right here at home.  How many Sushi restaurants don't have a single Japanese chef, or employee, it is just people who think it is wise to ride the crest of delicious Japanese cuisine and culture.  They also don't know how to make sushi.  "AH we don't put a dot of wasabi between the terrible rice and the fish.
I have seen these operations spring up often fooling the public into thinking they are really Japanese and Japanese who know how to run a great sushi restaurant.  If you need to make a buck this way you owe the Japanese a great deal of praise for stealing their  idea and pretending it is not a Chinese restaurant.  and not even making sushi rice correctly.  Stay away from this and all other pretend Japanese sushi restaurants.  I am telling you the Chinese are not thinking quality, heritage and customs, they are thinking about making a buck at the expense of the real Japanese chefs and thousand years of refinement
author: rick l.

description:
free edamame
love the special roll we had: unagi, tuna, crab
nice decor
reasonable prices
author: Captain B.

description: Just had dinner there, it was ok. The service was what killed it for me though. Ordered a Sapporo and it went to the table next to us. Ordered a couple rolls and the couple next to us (who got there after we did) got their food before we did (and they ordered a lot). The sushi itself was just ok. If you end up going there, try the double hamachi roll. That's what got this place its 3rd star.
author: Jenny X.

description:
This place is one of my favorite.  I took my brother there and he loved it.
Great service Great food. Thanks
author: rajeef M.

description: Surprised to find this in the Lower Haight.  Pleasantly surprised.  The live uni was off the hook.  When I asked the sushi chef to make a "super hot" roll...holly crap did he make it HOT.  I'm not sure that was a very good idea, with my system being tore up from a couple of brews eariler at Molotov and a couple more at Sushi Raw.  Final verdict: Food was excellent and service was wonderful.  Very nice folks, both servers and chef.
author: Amelia C.

description: Easily the worst sushi I've had in the city. Everything we ordered was mushy and sloppily cut. One star for the delivery guy being really nice, and one star for the edamame. Maybe we just caught them on an off night, but I wouldn't try it again.
author: Jessica S.

description:
I want Baghdad Nights back :(  

I've gotten the nigiri here, and it's very mediocre.  The fish is too cold, and just not all that tasty. To be fair, I got the sushi as take-out, which is never as good as eating it at the restaurant.  If I were drunk, I'd probably like this sushi.  Otherwise, I'd probably go elsewhere.
author: Sam B.

description:
I ate here last night for a friend's birthday.
The fresh sashimi blew me away. 
The eclipse roll is delicious. YUM.
I love this place.
author: C B.

description:
-ambiance: virtually nonexistent.  they've got one of those scenarios going on where there is a bench seat built along the wall, with tables placed in front and completed with a chair on the other side.  if you're sitting in the booth, you have to hunch over really awkwardly to engage with the person across the table (read: to not feel like you're 15 feet away).  it's got that burma superstar vibe where you're sitting right on top of complete strangers.  somehow, at burma superstar this feels acceptable where here it just doesn't feel... right.  another thing is the artwork.  my boyfriend and i were completely shocked to find out all the pieces were by the same artist.  there is definitely something to be said for variety but this artist is all over the place with no defined style whatsoever.  some of the paintings were 'ok' at best, but some were nothing more than an eyesore.  sorry -- i don't like critiquing, i really don't.  but it was just... weird.

-waitstaff:  "eh".  just eh.  they may as well be feeding cattle for all it seems that they care.  one of the servers was nice about heating up our sake when we requested it after having had our first two tepid sakes.  i'm a fan of doing things the easy/smart/least time consuming way, but sometimes the servers in the area upstairs would communicate (LOUDLY) with the servers downstairs and hand stuff to each other through the iron bars between the floors and it just looked kind of... unprofessional.

-cold, soggy edemame,  but at least it's complimentary.

-i'll say it's a little overpriced when you consider the entire experience.

-2-4-1 sake and beer is a nice special, although our sake, as i mentioned above, came tepid the first time around.

-no cellphone reception.

as far as the pros go, they get A+ for presentation for sure.  their vegetarian options aren't too vast, but they do offer the "Pink Lady" roll, which is what i had -- asparagus, cucumber, mushroom and mango, wrapped in soy paper (YEY!)... and it was really delicious.  i was kind of miffed when it was served with no wasabi to be found, but they brought us some extra wasabi to the table right away when we asked for some.  jake got the "4 Seasons" roll and loved it.  said it was fresh and tasty and again, their presentation was pretty amazing.  there was a spiderweb of wasabi mayo, teriyaki sauce and ginger sauce on the plate and it looked pretty rad.

to sum it up: the food is really quite good and the portions are large.  it is served with lovely presentation... but the rest of the experience definitely leaves something to be desired.
author: Beccie F.

description: Mediocre sushi...I came here b/c I wanted sushi and it was the nearest place.  Customer service could've been better.  Parking is a pain, but it's on Haight.....
author: Kay T.

description: I had two of the most amazing rolls I have ever had in my life.  One was called the "Pink Lady" the other was called the "Four Seasons".... WOW! It makes me want leave New York and move to San Francisco.
author: jenny m.

description:
Another sushi restaurant in Lower Haight...Woohoo!  My bf and I stopped by Sushi Raw for their Grand Opening. I was kinda skeptical when we walked up to the door because the restaurant looked empty.  It turned out that the back area was packed with people.  They have a wide selection of food both cooked and raw. The sashimi and sushi rolls were very fresh and tasty. They have a 2 for 1 beer night... even better!

The sushi bar seats about 12 and there's plenty of tables too. If you're looking for a semi-quiet dinner I would suggest you stay in the front area. The back seating area can get quite noisy.
author: Ruben G.

description: This place is decent. I love their service and the fact that they will bring food next door to Danny Coyle's. I just don't really care for their food. Keep in mind that I'm judging their vegetarian & chicken options. My friends like their seafood (aka the real sushi), so it's definitely worth a try.
author: Lara C.

description: Not bad, not amazing either. The fish was decent quality but the rolls didn't seem to be made with enough care....a little sloppy and inconsistent in my book. Still, some good cheap options and they deliver.
author: Sara W.

description: Perfectly good sushi, reasonably priced. Perhaps the welcome was a bit overly friendly.. the staff greets arriving guests with a hearty yell. Some of the many paintings on the walls (presumably by local artists) were interesting. Nice paper lampshades over the sushi bar.
author: Kevin O.

description: The food is pretty good but their takeout is haphazard.  I've ordered takeout at least a dozen times from them and there is always drama associated with the order -- either it takes longer than expected or they lost the order.  Even when you call them to find out when it'll be ready, they can't seem to get their act together.  When you finally do get the food, it's pretty decent.  Also the folks who work there are really nice.  They just can't get their pickup system worked out.  If they could make the takeout system more efficient, I'd give them 4 stars.
author: Mark D.

description: More like "Eh-OK" instead of "A-OK."  Went here for a quick bite before a night of hard drinking.  I've had better sushi, but the sushi bar staff were very friendly and incredibly fast.  The waitresses, on the other hand, were slow and sort of spacey.  Our drinks came in the middle of our meal.  The buy-1-get-1-free sake or beer special was very nice, but yeah, the slowness of said drinks kinda sucks.  The edamame were cold (maybe this is a west coast thing) and unseasoned, so kinda bland.  There are better Japanese restaurants, but if you're in the neighborhood check it out...The Plum Flower roll was tres bien!
author: Jesse R.

description: It's good, but not great. If you're really craving sushi, then this will get you your fix, however I wouldn't drive out of my way to go here. I go mainly for the convenience of it's location. You won't be disappointed with your food, you also won't be blown away by it.
author: Josh G.

description:
food was fine but everything should have been two dollars less than we paid for it. decent fish but not a good value. 

sashimi was still frozen in the middle. upon bringing it to their attention, nobody even apologized. (nine bucks for five pieces of frozen fish. sweet deal, guys.)

they forgot both of our miso soups, and upon reminder, only brought one out. 

skip the wonky tunes and bright decor and head down the street to amasia hide instead.
author: who k.

description:
if you're in the 'hood and you want some sushi, this is the place. 
there's way better further afield, but this place is local, affordable and the rolls are very good. the eclipse roll is amazing.
author: Brett W.

description: I have been meaning to review this restaurant because I have eaten at this place quite a few times with friends and my family. I have lived near the lower Haight for several years and I never would eat Japanese food in the area until Sushi Raw opened. Now that we have a 2 year old toddler are choices are somewhat limited about where we eat in the city but the waitresses at this place are really nice even if my son leaves a huge mess of rice on the floor after we leave. Most importantly the food is fresh and reasonably priced. We still have our favorite Japanese restaurants in Japan town but if you are in the lower Haight this is the only place to eat Japanese food.
author: Camille S.

description: Never dined in, but boy are they quick with the delivery.  This is not where you go when you want good sushi, it's where you go, when you want cheap and quick sushi.  The fish is definitely not the freshest.  So I wouldn't go for the Sashimi if I were you.  We probably order from here at least once a month, more like twice a month.
author: Nancy V.

description:
I went to Sushi Raw last night to check it out.
Yes, the art was pretty random & weird, but provided
lots of fodder for conversation.
The staff and service was friendly & prompt.  They yelled
hello & goodbye in japanese, just like in the old days.
We must have made good menu choices, everything was tasty.
Really liked the double hamachi roll ( fried & raw hamachi 
with tobiko ),
great thinly sliced cucumber roll with fish & light citrus sauce,
and the basics were good, the seaweed & spinach.
The staff didn't seem to know the specifics of the raw oysters,
other than they were from Washington, medium sized.  They were
sweet & delicious.  Ordered a half dozen & a two piece sample
of the mackerel on their suggestion.  Yum.
We asked to move upstairs cause the table next to us were
clearly enjoying the two for one sake deal past their
alcohol tolerance levels. 
One important warning.  If you hate mayo, make sure to let them know as the menu isn't clear on which dishes are decorated with this swill.
If you love the stuff, never mind.    
They do free delivery.
Open lunch and dinner.  
Support local biz.
author: Lynn F.

description: I've ordered 4 or 5 times from Raw Sushi and never had anything but good experiences, except this last Thursday night. I got food poisoning, bad, really bad. I've been laid up in bed for two days. Like I said, up to this point, they been good, so give it a try if you like. But I won't be back.
author: Byrne B.

description: Ohhh...I'm so disappointed with this establishment...food wise that is...I'll give it a 4 star for decor...it's beautiful inside....lovely music...very sweet waitress...adore the artworks displayed on the walls by local artists...but  the food...oh...so disappointing...the only thing that was okay...the California rolls...I'd come back to hang out...because it's beautiful inside...but not to eat...okay...I'll snack on California rolls and edamame...for kicks...sip me some warm sake...but don't take me word for it...I'm rather picky when it comes to food...the place itself is very nice...and I'm happy that the waitress and the guy preparing my lunch are Japanese...not that I'm unhappy when they're not...it's more authentic when they are...but in this case it doesn't really matter because I didn't quite enjoy myself here..I meant the food.....just a tad disappointed...shrugs...
author: Persimmon W.

description: I really like this place. But in my mind the old one is more better. The atmosphere on Height's ok. However, the food stil nice, the price more higher from the first place but it's make sense abotu the area.
author: pete s.

description: Having lived nearly 5 years in Japan I think I am able to say when a Japanese restaurant is authentic or not.  This food was definitely NOT authentic. An hour later I still have a decidedly un-Japanese aftertaste in my mouth. I had a very bizarre dish called "Superwhite Tuna"...I'd asked for shiro-maguro.  What was it? I have NO idea.  The hirame was nothing like the hirame I've had before...too pink and it seemed like poor-quality maguro...not the thinly sliced white flounder I know. The kara-age chicken was undercooked and covered with mayo sauce.  I prefer the chicken to be fried golden and to put my own sauce on my food.  It seems as if the oil they used was not the type used in Japan...thus leaving the aftertaste.  Still wondering what it was about this food that I didn't like.  The room and the wait staff were fine and friendly...
author: G. W.

description: Finally!!! Sushi in lower Haight that won't make me incredibly sick!! A great addition to the neighborhood. Sushi Raw is the perfect stop when you need soup to keep you warm or a healthier meal alternative.
author: Makela C.

description: Meh. Its kind of all you can get in the neighborhood, and they have online ordering which is nice but... I don't know... its not super spectacular. I'd rather order delivery from Blue Fin in the Richmond and deal with the wait.
author: J J.

description: got the teriyaki beef which was a bit chewy but the quality was ok for a lunch special menu. the hot tea was way overly strong though. the sushi that the rest of the table had was 'lunch special quality' but pretty cheap overall, so no one really had any complaints other than 'eh, it was ok', btu we expected that.
author: Sydel S.

description: The fish at this place is fresh. I consider myself a sushi connoisseur and I have to say that although the fish is fresh they do not cut it right. The pieces are a bit too thick so it doesn't melt in your mouth the way it should even though you can tell it would if it was a better cut. Also I happened to be there at the end of the night when they were closing and the owner did not treat her staff well and didn't seem to care that we saw her yelling "HARDER, HARDER!" to the guy mopping up the floor. I felt really bad for him. I also understand wanting to get out of work early but I think the customer should always be first and I found myself waiting for them to put things away before getting my order fulfilled. I would never go back here for the shear reason that I did not like the way the staff was treated or myself for that matter. I felt pushed out even though I was done with my meal at the exact time they closed. Also my boyfriend left his card there and they charged him twice!
author: D K.

description: The word for this place is fantastic. A filling meal for 2 for about $20. The atmosphere is pleasent and clean, the service is fast, people are helpful, and the best tempura I've ever had. Been going here for a while and love it every time.
author: Siannan G.

description: The food *looks* great -- and some of the rolls are fabulous -- but you definitely run risk of biting into a piece of sashimi with fibers in it that you can't bite through.  3 visits, three scattered pieces of not-so-hot sashimi.
author: nicky c.

description: Three stars fro the friendly staff and interesting decor (cool artwork).  However, the sushi is sub-par.  I've eaten sushi here three times and have always left disappointed.  I found the rice really dry and rolls didn't have that much meat in them.  I also love how they've had the grand opening sign up for many months now :)
author: Sheila K.

description: There provide many creative sushi rolls.  I am typically like Texas Roll, rice covered by a thin layer of beef .  It was unexpected tasty.  You should try it.
author: Peg L.

description: To the folks that gave this place 5 stars... really, "as good as it gets"... I think not. Go here if you don't want to spend the extra $50+ at Tsunami or Cebo, but don't go here expecting anything other than average Americanized sushi.. which is fine for a snack with a few beers.
author: Jon G.

description: my boyfriend and I (esp him) are huge sushi fans. a friend recommended this place to us, and we live in the neighborhood, so we decided to check it out. we went in early, around 5:30, and had pretty much the whole place to ourselves. I was surprised at how 'swanky' this place was. really cool art, eclectic music, comfortable yet modern and stylish ambiance, and the staff was super friendly. we were starving, so we went a little crazy. we started with a big bottle of sapporo and some cold sake. they have an awesome 2 for 1 beer and sake special.  then onto a tempura appetizer, which was honestly THE best tempura i have ever had. the vegetables/shrimp were so fresh, and the batter just melts in your mouth. then the chef's choice sashimi plate. 12 pieces of amazing sashimi for only $15! then the caterpillar roll...which was decent. and the spicy tuna roll, which was only $5 and delicious! the service was great.  everyone was so friendly and really attentive. we"ll definitely be going back. soon.
author: Kristin F.
